title: Double double
developerResponse: {'id': 1336870, 'body': "Thanks for the feedback. Great idea on adding names for personalized coffee. We're making continuous enhancements to the app, and will add that to our list!", 'modified': '2017-09-23T14:33:59Z'}
review: They deleted the double double button. It was so much easier! And if you can add names for personalized coffee that will be perfect because you don't know which one is which especially when you are ordering for lots of people! Thanks!

title: Add Wallet comptability
review:
Starbucks has done the rewards points and digital card right. You only need to open the Wallet app (double click power button) with all your other digital cards. AND your digital balance and rewards are linked on one card so you only need to scan once. 

I don‚Äôt want to have to dig through my apps, find the Tims app, wait a few seconds for it to load, click on the reward card to use it then click on the digital balance to pay. Bad design

title: Apple wallet
review: It would be nice to be able to access my Tim card balance with the Apple Wallet instead of having to unlock the phone and then go to the Tim app.

title: Thieves!
review: I lost at least 70 dollars worth of saved gift cards because the app logged me off one fine day. When I went back on, I had a zero balance! It‚Äôs been almost 3 weeks and still no one at the head office has gotten back to me. To top it off, the app is no longer working at the location I always go to. It shows an ‚Äúx‚Äù in the app under locations. Yet the machine for mobile pick ups works for others. Not happy with all the glitches with this app!

title: Beware!
review: Bought a Tim card to transfer to app ( as I have numerous times). Keep getting error message. Call Tim‚Äôs - randomly they no longer permit this yet their website states you can. Waste of time and money.

title: Update ruined it
review:
Last updates wiped my balance and rewards (that‚Äôs stealing, just FYI) and all of my history, now I can‚Äôt add balance back. So, basically I can‚Äôt use this app.
I waited patiently for it to resolve, nope. I wrote to their support and received nothing back after several weeks. Sooo...now I give one star. Fix it!! And don‚Äôt forget to respond to support tickets!

Oh and also, you are WAY overdoing it with new menu items. Too cluttered. TH had an identify, now it‚Äôs a mess.

title: Crap
review: I got an email notification that I‚Äôd no longer be able to use my google sign in but an email address. Okay no biggie. Go to Tim‚Äôs this am, order a coffee. I have a $20 card loaded in the app as well as my Tim rewards. App says I have to log in with an email so I use my gmail. Get a verification code. Enter it. ‚ÄòSorry we are unable to find your account‚Äô. I tried again. Same response. I enter another email thinking maybe I didn‚Äôt use gmail. Same thing. Retry. I have three email addresses and I tried all three multiple times whether entering the code manually or tapping through the link in the verification email to get to the app in my phone. I‚Äôve tried now about ten times. Nothing. I had to pay for my coffee with cash and I didn‚Äôt get my points. Not looking promising for reaching anyone judging by others‚Äô comments. I‚Äôd better get my $20 back and I won‚Äôt be using this dumb app again.

title: Garbage
review:
I started writing to the app creator about how difficult it had been to use the app and just to contact support, they make you go through a checklist of things to try (as if it‚Äôs your fault). I did them and of course it still doesn‚Äôt work. Then they close the chat session automatically and direct you to another long form with unrelated questions to answer. 

Easier to just say your app sucks. It does not work and I‚Äôve tried randomly for a few months now thinking one day it will. 

Going to Starbucks.

title: Why all the needless updating
review: It was nice when the app first came out. I liked it and it was convenient. Then they started rolling out updates some broke the app some made it work again, some were intuitive some down right confusing. The last iteration was working well and easy to use and the did it again, another update. Now there is an even longer process to order and not very straight forward.  Thanks for nothing. Then there are these new lids that leak everywhere that customers and employees hate. Thanks  again. I have been a customer for Almost 50 years and I think it is time for a change.

title: Sucks: Eats up your moneyüí∞
review:
I got a French Vanilla from Tim Hortons online and had to pay for ONE DRINK AT LEAST 3 TIMES!!! This is really disappointing it just ate my money! Then I called Tim‚Äôs and asked where my order was. (As everyone else would do the same). They said they never got my order and said to pay again. I complained to them and even showed them my BILL that I have PAYED!! They still said to pay again, since they never got my order. This app is just trash. Totally trash. I would totally recommend the Starbucks app over this one!
I would only have this app back if you guys fix this bug!!üò°

title: Updated version SUCKS
review:
I enjoy the look of the new updated version of the app, but they changed so much that I barely know how to use it anymore! 
1. There‚Äôs no where to add a gift card on there. PLUS they make it 10x harder to reload from a saved paying method (visa, debit, etc) 
2. Trying to find the location you usually use is now completely haywire because it won‚Äôt show you what the place you want looks like to get the right location. Because if this I chose the wrong location for my mobile order on my way to work, missed my order which had me starving to death at work, and I lost about $5 from that.

I love Tim hortons with all my heart, but this is ridiculous. Why fix something that wasn‚Äôt broken in the first place?

title: Garbage

title: Horrible App and Support

What kind of company creates an app, then out of the blue springs an automatic update which forces you to resign in right before your are ready to pay. It tells you that you will receive an email before you can log in but the email never comes. Now you have held up the line, Tim Hortons has your money hostage and you can‚Äôt pay because you didn‚Äôt bring your wallet. This company does not care about its customers otherwise issues like this would be avoided. I have now deleted the app and will prefer to give my money to Starbucks. They know how to support an app and you can always get in touch with their support department. 
FYI what happens in the Tim Hortons commercials is far from reality in their locations.

title: Revamp made it worse
review: I used to love the app, easy to use, you could reorder at the same restaurant with one button and you could log in with Facebook. They updated it in December and I thought I‚Äôd give it a bit to see if it would grow on me, but nope I still hate it. You can‚Äôt really save your settings like you could before and you have to go through several long steps to order the same thing you do every day even if you use the reorder button. Often it logs me out and I have to sit there waiting for an Authenticator email and because I originally signed in with face book the app is connected to an obscure email I don‚Äôt use anymore and it won‚Äôt let me change it. It is sometimes shorter and more convenient to stand in line then to use the app now.

title: Tim Hortons App
review: It‚Äôs all a lie! Do your research. Tim Hortons is no longer a TRUE CANADIAN COMPANY! I am paying for a service. They are not barbers or waitresses who were the only personal you used to tip! Why is everyone thinking they are entitled? They are in business of retail and think they should be entitled! I serve this country as a profession and I don‚Äôt ask for a tip! Imagine if I did. You‚Äôd think that was absurd, but yet I don‚Äôt ask for a tip while my pay looks good on paper you should also see what taxes I pay! I provide your freedom and sound sleep every night. Do your job and serve the public without expectations like myself. And for you rich privileged people no matter you race, yes I said it! Black, White, Tanned, Albino, etc!!!!!, gender or religion stop selling the country out that every generation of my family has stood up to defend! Yes, my family were immigrants from Switzerland and Ireland. But they left it behind and accepted the Canadian way for a better life! We keep our family‚Äôs get together‚Äôs to ourselves and still say Merry Christmas! If you don‚Äôt like where you are, please with all due respect leave. You can only be so lucky to call yourself CANADIAN!!

title: Roll up the rim is now ruined
review:
This new roll up the rim setup is absolutely terrible. Are people to lazy to roll up the rim, I think not, corporations cronies hate simple old ways that work best. You cronies must be winning over the young minded and hardly working foe. Tims use to be cherished amongst us Canucks but now its a sellout owned by greasy burgerking. Service has gone down, staff is NOT polite like they use to be but good thing Starbucks employees are nice and understandable.  It's simple, Starbucks is in and Tim's is out.

title: Worst Coffee App
developerResponse: {'id': 15828402, 'body': 'Hey! While we wish you‚Äôd had a better app experience, we really appreciate the feedback. Any chance you can provide us with some additional details at timhortons.com/support so that we can follow up?', 'modified': '2020-06-07T18:16:19Z'}
review:
Maybe get the developers to download the Starbucks app to see how a coffee app should work. Starbucks has one scan code that lets you collect reward, use rewards and pay for your coffee all from one touch of the app.
Tim‚Äôs app make you go to the rewards scan code, have the code scanned by the employee, then you take the phone back and click on the pay app, which you then present to the Tim‚Äôs employee, who then rolls her eyes at you because she assumed you were going to use your debit card, then she has to punch in a bunch of things, so you can then use your pay app to buy the coffee.
Don‚Äôt even get me started on Tim‚Äôs asinine way of using their rewards. Instead of just telling the employee that you‚Äôd like to use your rewards and then scan your code, like Starbucks does, Tim‚Äôs makes it excruciatingly painful.
First you have to go to your account then click on Tim‚Äôs rewards, then click on redeem, then click on which item you want, then click on bank the points, then....
You get the picture how nauseating this app is?

title: My review of Tim‚Äôs
developerResponse: {'id': 21550444, 'body': 'Hey! While we wish you‚Äôd had a better app experience, we really appreciate the feedback. Any chance you can provide us with some additional details at timhortons.com/support so that we can follow up?', 'modified': '2021-03-09T22:47:22Z'}
review:
So this is not about the app. I am really enjoying the app. I find it fun and well set up. 

I am extremely frustrated with our 2 stores in dundas.  For example one store doesn‚Äôt open until 9. On Saturday, they weren‚Äôt open until 9:05 and at that point they weren‚Äôt ready for people.  They didn‚Äôt have coffee ready or baked things out. I believe they only had one staff member serving and she was quite curt with people who were waiting. I understand that she was stressed but she was in a position she should NOT have been in.  The manager did not have that store ready. By 9:15 over 5 people were in line with no one having been helped 

At both locations, service is not friendly, orders are often incorrect and at the drive through location I have waited up to 8 minutes IN the store without any acknowledgment or service.

Our Dundas stores used to be wonderful shops. Little community friendly places where all were welcome. That has changed drastically!  So sad

And the coffee is horrible tasting. Harsh and weak. I think a 2 star review is generous!!!

title: Two issues, but otherwise great
developerResponse: {'id': 21339094, 'body': 'Hey! While we wish you‚Äôd had a better app experience, we really appreciate the feedback. Any chance you can provide us with some additional details at timhortons.com/support so that we can follow up?', 'modified': '2021-02-27T18:40:07Z'}
review:
Last update:
Yeah, Tim‚Äôs hockey challenge is broken. 3 days now I‚Äôve made picks and then the following day it said I didn‚Äôt make any. Thanks for offering this still Tim‚Äôs, the gesture is still appreciated!

Update:
More bugs :/

First off, it was difficult even opening the Tim‚Äôs Hockey Challenge yesterday in the app. Then, when I got in, my picks were picked and registered but don‚Äôt show up today. That is, I take screenshots of my picks after it says ‚ÄúYour Picks Are Locked!‚Äù, just so it‚Äôs easier to see who my picks are during the games. Either way, none of my picks scores, but when I went to make picks today, it said I didn‚Äôt make any for yesterday?

To be more clear, I made picks yesterday, took a screenshot when the app said they‚Äôre picked, went on today and it said I didn‚Äôt make picks yesterday. Hopefully this‚Äôll be fixed soon though.

Original:
First, going into the app to activate offers is a little annoying... simply because you have to tap twice to activate ONE offer. That is, you tap ‚ÄúActivate‚Äù for the app to load the offer page, then ‚ÄúActivate‚Äù on this page to actually activate the offer... why not have you tap just once?

Better yet, why not just have an activate all offer?

Second, hockey‚Äôs back, so that means the Tim‚Äôs Hockey Challenge is also back. I noticed there‚Äôs a ‚ÄúI‚Äôd like reminders for upcoming games and prizes I‚Äôve won.‚Äù, which was great because I always forgot about choosing my picks. But after a few days, I‚Äôve realized now I haven‚Äôt once gotten the notifications.

Weird, I thought I turned them on... okay, let‚Äôs just go check. >Enabled. Ah, okay then I must have turned off notifications in the Settings. Let‚Äôs go check that.... Wait, there‚Äôs no option for notifications in the settings app now for Tim Horton‚Äôs...

So if you go into your settings and scroll all the way to the bottom of the main page, you‚Äôll see a list of all your apps. There you can tap each one to change a number of things (location, Siri, notifications, etc). Every app (for the most part) has an option to change notification locations, sounds, badges, preview, and grouping. However, the Tim‚Äôs app doesn‚Äôt have this.

I suspect that whatever part of the programming that contains this batch of data is broken because there is no ability for us to change anything for the Tim‚Äôs app‚Äôs notifications (in other words, that‚Äôs likely why I‚Äôm not getting notifications).

I‚Äôm sure this‚Äôll get fixed in time though.

iPhone 11 Pro, iOS 14.3, newest version of the app as of Feb. 6, 2021.

title: GARBAGE APP STEALS YOUR MONEY
review: This app keeps deleting your saved credit cards and Tim cards and it also deletes any balances you had on your Tim‚Äôs cards. Month after month the app tells me to check my credit card info when I place an order and to make sure I have entered the card information correctly, even though it‚Äôs a ‚Äúsaved‚Äù card and it works some of the time.  Within a few days it may start working again and accept my payment method.  Not only is the app garbage, so is their customer service.  I have reached out to support numerous times, both by phone and email and it is the biggest waste of time.  They give you a general response and then I can‚Äôt get a reply after following up.   Just one big run around after the other.  FIX YOUR APP!  There are so many other great places to get coffee out there and that offer reliable apps for ordering.  I personally have had enough of the run around and stolen money.

title: Pandemic Relief
review:
I thank the Tim's app for many reasons :

During the pandemic I felt safer placing my order, paying for it and simply picking it up.

Since my name is on the app.  The servers got to know my name and it was a nice  when they recognized me by name.  

During this stay at home time it renewed my interest in hockey by having some fun with the scorer selection.   I often stayed up later to see who scored.  Or checked the next day. 

Interesting how the app improved over time.  
My son and I would text each other about the points each had earned and who had the better hockey picks.  

Thanks Tims !!

title: Won‚Äôt get your order, 3 week refund wait
review: To begin with, this app doesn‚Äôt load under the best conditions, you have to constantly close and reopen the app in order for it to load menu options (which it doesn‚Äôt even have a full list of). Then assuming you struggle through the loading issues, it‚Äôll give you multiple issues trying to place your order; either not loading the checkout screen, or not allowing a way to proceed from it. If you manage to successfully place the order there‚Äôs still no guarantees for you as even 10-15 minutes after successfully placing the order an app glitch can cancel the entire order - and at that point you might as well give up because there‚Äôs no way to speak directly with support for assistance in app (or on site) and upon contacting the store the order was placed with, they don‚Äôt have a direct number but will provide you with their internal number (although they will finally be able to provide you with that number - 1 (888) 601-1616 for anyone in a similar circumstance). When finally able to contact their support though they state refunds take 5-14 business days (1-3 weeks) to be processed. If your wanting Tims just get it through another app/delivery service, or go somewhere else for food.

title: All around WORST app ever
review: First off you have to wait forever for it to load.then when you want to use the points that you painstakingly acquired 10 x10 you can only use them for one item at a time?????? They are points earned people should be able to use them when they want for whatever they want!!! Tim hortons has gone down for good!

title: Inventory not updated
review: Deleted the app. Store Inventories are not accurate or updated. You go to pick up your order and find out it‚Äôs not available at the store. Also they force you to store your credit card info in the app which I‚Äôm definitely NOT comfortable with.

title: Good! But customization for sauces needed
review:
Works consistently well across many Nova Scotia Tims locations. Kudos to the team for the Apple Pay integration. Now I‚Äôm no longer stuck in the $5 Tim Card loop.

However, I am unable to remove sauces from some sandwiches, such as the new Cravables. This forces me to order these items at the counter. The Farmer‚Äôs Wrap also had this issue a few months ago, but is fixed now. Hoping this oversight is soon resolved for all sandwiches.

In addition, some Tim Hortons restaurants will not announce your name when your order is ready at the counter. Better training is required in this regard.

title: What I order often not available
review: Multiple times I have tried to order dream donuts through the app, paid for my order, but when I get to the restaurant the donut I have ordered is not available. It wouldn‚Äôt be a problem, except dream donuts cost more than regular kinds, so I‚Äôve paid double the cost of the regular donut I end up with. Starbucks has got this figured out - if a product isn‚Äôt available at a certain location, it isn‚Äôt available to order on their app. I think Tim Hortons needs to figure out how to do this better!

title: App won‚Äôt load

title: Bug since yesterday (Feb. 13th, 2021)

When I click on the Mobile app icon, it brings me to a solid white screen. I can no longer see my points, or order, or bank my points, or use my accumulated points for a free coffee, or or or. How do I resolve this problem?

Also, I can‚Äôt use the ‚ÄúSupport‚Äù button - I only get the white screen therefore don‚Äôt have the option to explain my grievance.

title: Lost my money
review: I added money twice this week and lost my money. It got charged from my account but it didn‚Äôt added to my tim card.

title: Not impressed
review:
Orders fail to go through constantly.  Sometimes the app shows the order didn‚Äôt process, so you try again only to find out you‚Äôve been double charged.  Then you have to wait in line until someone finds the time to give you a refund.  Sort of defeats the purpose of ordering ahead.  Lame.  Also, not being able to customize sandwiches isn‚Äôt ideal.  

Oh, and don‚Äôt bother using the delivery function.  Placed a $60 order that never arrived.  Contacted customer service & received an automated message stating I‚Äôd receive a response in 48hours.  48 hours?  No food, no guarantee of a refund.  Next time wait 48hours before charging your customers for food they might not get.  Only fair.

Step your game up.

review: App takes forever to load and only actually loads half the time. When it does load, the offers will often just disappear and I need to start the whole process all over again. Overall just an awful app.

title: Reloading card
review:
I have added two credit cards. I was able to reload from my Amex once and it has never worked since. And the Master Card works on and off. I was just in line and it wouldn‚Äôt work, so i had to leave the line go to my car, get my wallet and pay. Not the first time this happens. 
Also there is no option to use my reward at a later time or keep collecting rewards. 
Check out Starbucks app, you could really use some pointers from them!

title: App not working

title: Flawed
review: It's convenient but severely flawed. The stores don't keep what's available in the store. You can order something on the app, but it's not guaranteed to be at the store when you pick it up, charges you instantly when making the order so if something happens and you can't pick up the order you have to jump through hoops with the stores management just to try and get what you paid for. Constant drop down menus for everything (sizes could simply be the same as you have the regular/DD/TT Option you have already available) just a mess to navigate and like I said, they aren't linked to the stores inventory so you aren't guaranteed in getting the item you paid for, but they will refund it while you are in the drive thru.... real fun holding up the line.

title: Wont send verification code
review: App says it sent me a verification code but it never does. I can‚Äôt get in and it‚Äôs very frustrating!!!!

title: Terrible App
review: I don‚Äôt use the same store over and over. I generally go to different ones, often I‚Äôm not familiar with the stores. The issues I‚Äôve had are entering an order and paying only to show up to find out the store is closed. Also, I‚Äôve often ordered certain items, pay and show up to find out they don‚Äôt have what I ordered. Then I‚Äôm told the store can‚Äôt refund my money for mobile orders and that I have to go through the app. It is hard to find the solution to request a refund which takes way too much time. The app is slow regardless of the wifi or other network I use, especially when having to use the ‚Äúmap‚Äù function and then having to check the pictures to determine if the store is a kiosk in a gas station or some other store. Several times I‚Äôve looked for stores using their map only to find out they don‚Äôt exist. The app is so slow it‚Äôs quicker to go through the drive through. It‚Äôs very frustrating.

title: Can‚Äôt use mobile order and pay
review: I haven‚Äôt been able to reload my app with my credit card for about two months now. I have submitted a support ticket but they can‚Äôt seem to find out what‚Äôs wrong. It‚Äôs not the fault of my card provider as I have contacted them. This app sucks and has put me off from going to Tim‚Äôs.

title: Ordering tea
review: Love my Tim Hortons app efficiency is great. I just wish there was an option for me to ask for one of my specialty teabags on the side. When I order an extra large tea.

title: Websites, Apps, and Reloadable Crap.
review: I went onto their website to check their menu and it was completely outdated. I was told to download the app, which I‚Äôve done and it was the worst mistake ever. First off I had to make an account JUST to view the menu; I should note that I don‚Äôt visit Tim Hortons nearly enough to even want to make an account. I just wanted to see the menu. FF to Christmas and I was given a reloadable Tim‚Äôs gift card so seeing as how I HAD to make an account to view the menu, I decided to add it onto my account. Well the app crashed within seconds of adding my card and when I restarted it, my card balance was completely gone. I‚Äôve complained to their head office multiple times but they don‚Äôt care. So besides being possibly the worst coffee shop in my town, they also have the worst customer service.

title: Full of technical issues

title: Something always goes wrong
review: Convenient to pre order, but expect to try to submit your order 2 or 3 times before it works. I often get told that restaurants are sold out of coffee and to try again later.  Payments don‚Äôt always go through... on and on

title: A disaster, much like what‚Äôs happened to Tim‚Äôs since US ownership
review: In one word this app is buggy. It‚Äôs an inconsistent temperamental experience. Sometimes features work, sometimes they don‚Äôt. Random requests for logging in again with a bizarre approach that requires access to your e-mail. Current biggest bug is ordering and reloading at the same time: no order confirmation and in fact order stays in cart but the order has gone through. Argh!

title: Unreasonable challenge, no more reward offers
review:
This week‚Äôs challenge for me was to visit Tim‚Äôs 10 times at a minimum of $6 per order to receive 200 bonus points. I think it‚Äôs unreasonable to challenge someone to go more than once a day, unless it‚Äôs a smaller amount like the price of a beverage.

Additionally for months I‚Äôve been receiving and using bonus point offers. My favourite is use the app and get an additional 10 points. This week there was no offers at all for me. 

So without any offers the benefits to using this app is that I save other people in the line up time by having my order pre-made and also save the people at Tim‚Äôs time and touching from having to deal with voice ordering and manual payment. This is at the expense of my time of doing this in advance. I do benefit from less touches at the drive through window. Certainly I like to help others out, but there should be some kind of incentive or appreciation for people that use the app.

review:

Half the time I need to use the app to pay, it either opens into a white screen or black screen and does not function, or just freezes. This leads to me not being able to access my money that I have loaded into the Tims app. 

I have had these issues since I first downloaded the app when it came out. I am shocked that it has not been solved. 

Save your money and do not use this app. It‚Äôs not worth it, even for the points they let you redeem.

title: Bring back the direct Apple Pay feature. Don‚Äôt want to be saving my card details in the app itself.
review:
I used the app a lot before the latest update. I like that I could place my order and make payment, all from my phone, without having my credit/debit card information stored in the app itself. 

Before the update, you could add item/s to your cart then hit continue after which Apple Pay would automatically pop up, you make the payment and that‚Äôs it. 

Now that option have been removed. You can no longer make purchases without having your card info saved in the app. I don‚Äôt like that and I won‚Äôt be using the app anymore. 

Which means I will probably start to cut back on my coffee intake as I‚Äôm not about to be joining any lines in store.

review: The app works fine it‚Äôs just so unnecessarily complicated for some reason. There‚Äôs so much going on and it took me way too long to figure out how to register a gift card someone had given me onto the app. Why is there two different things to scan? Why is it asking to choose a rewards level and what does that mean? It‚Äôs just not intuitive and I could see it being a problem for someone who‚Äôs not necessarily as familiar with technology.

title: Removed Apple Pay Option
review: A few months ago they added the ability to pay the total (not reload card balance), using Apple Pay, but now they‚Äôve removed that option‚ÄîI can only reload my Tim card balance in increments of $5. I preferred the option of just paying the total of the transaction without having to load money onto the Tim‚Äôs card, and without having to add a credit card.

title: App stopped working entirely
review:
Can‚Äôt log in as the page just hangs after I enter my email. Contact support /ticketing page is broken too. 

Looks like the dev team broke the app then took a nice long Christmas break.

title: Generally functional but somewhat lacking
review:
I was excited to try this app and while it is functional in that you can buy Tim‚Äôs and collect points there are three key features that it is either lacking or has made it hard to figure out how to do:

1. If a person hasn‚Äôt added a credit card, it appears to be impossible to simply add a Tim‚Äôs card to the app. This is ridiculous and practically an invasion of privacy. Not everyone wants apps to have their credit card info even though they would love to use the app! And not everyone has credit cards. If there is a way to add a Tim‚Äôs card without having a credit card loaded, then they need to make the process a lot more obvious.

2. For heaven‚Äôs sake, link the Tim‚Äôs rewards with with the Tim‚Äôs card!! Starbucks does this. What  can‚Äôt Tim‚Äôs? We shouldn‚Äôt have to scan the app twice in this day and age. Probably I‚Äôm just a little peeved though because I learned today from someone working at Tim‚Äôs that we need to scan both the rewards and the Tim card screen - I have used this app a lot in the last few weeks and no one else told me that and I didn‚Äôt think to check if I was accumulating points. I missed out on a lot of points!

3. When using the app to buy a digital Tim‚Äôs card - please let the recipient print the gift certificate and use it! Not everyone uses the app! Or put in bold block letters that DIGITAL TIM CARDS CAN ONLY BE USED WITH THE APP. I was so excited to send someone a Tim‚Äôs card over email only to find out that they couldn‚Äôt even use it because they didn‚Äôt feel comfortable loading their credit card onto the app so that they could THEN load their digital Tim Card onto the app. I also called a Tim‚Äôs customer service line and complained about this. It‚Äôs just not fair.
 
Okay end of rant.... thanks for listening.

title: Bring Back Apple Pay

There‚Äôs still plenty of time to revert the app to a previous version and satisfy all the people leaving a 1 star review.

title: Waste of time
review:
Both the Tim‚Äôs digital gift cards and the Tim‚Äôs plastic cards have a 16-digit format: 1234-1234-1234-1234.  This format isn‚Äôt recognized by either of the two Tim‚Äôs apps here.

Those apps are in a completely different format: 
abcd-1234-abcd.

Good luck redeeming a digital gift card unless you want to bring in a 16-digit number and try explaining to a confused clerk.

title: App order works now, but...
review:
So I finally after 5+ months can order in app again.   However I find the deadline for the offers to be ridiculous.     I don‚Äôt know why the offer expires before 9pm when it used to be 11pm.    To be quite Frank, I and my family are quite annoyed by this, and the stores are equally as confused as to why this has changed and the strange expiry time.    Normally other businesses have their specials expire at closing, but since Tim Hortons opens till late, it only made sense it expires at midnight or as the previous expiration method of 11pm.

I seriously hope they fix this confusing discount expiration time.   And stay on top of all bugs and not fix them many months after the bugs are discovered by customers.

title: Not usable on iPhone 7.

Anyway, quit, killed and reopened the app to get past the rewards screen.  But it‚Äôs unable to find any Tim Hortons locations (data doesn‚Äôt load, even though I can select the location on the map).  Two show stopping bugs in under 20 seconds.

Rated 1 star. App is unusable due to these issues.

title: Terrible
review:
I don‚Äôt even know where to start...

I have four Tim‚Äôs locations in the city. I select the nearest one and order a coffee with almond milk...the screen says ‚Äúone moment, please. We are checking with the  restaurant‚Äù...and then says ‚Äúsome items in your cart aren‚Äôt available at your selected store. Please remove these selections and try again.‚Äù...hmm...how can Tim Hortons be out of coffee? So I tried again but this time I ordered black...it worked...so I can only assume that it was the almond milk that wasn‚Äôt available. 

So that‚Äôs problem number one. If something is out of stock, the app should tell me  SPECIFICALLY what is unavailable, instead of making the end user troubleshoot. This same problem comes up a lot With various  items on the menu

Problem number  two: THE ITEMS ARE NOT EVEN UNAVAILABLE! ya, that‚Äôs right. I got frustrated with the app and just went to the drive through. I ordered a coffee with almond milk at the very same location I tried in the app...and wouldn‚Äôt ya know it, I got just that...so why is the app saying that they don‚Äôt have it? 

The last problem: it does not like my credit card, even though I use it with no trouble everywhere else. In order to pay, I need to physically go to the   restaurant and load up my virtual Tim card.

I wanted to send an email, but I couldn‚Äôt find anything to give feedback for the app, I only found platforms to give location-specific feedback.

title: Always Displaying Errors

I‚Äôve tried ordering using many different cards & from multiple Tim Horton‚Äôs locations but it doesn‚Äôt work. The app itself is well designed & has a great UI, but what good is the app if I can‚Äôt submit an order?

title: Don‚Äôt download this app
review: The Tim Horton‚Äôs app is slow and sometimes won‚Äôt load properly. However, that‚Äôs not it‚Äôs biggest problem. It‚Äôs biggest issue is that they don‚Äôt accurately track what is available in the store. If you order something and then when you show up they don‚Äôt have it, the store can‚Äôt issue a refund ... you have to call the app customer service. I have been waiting 2 months and have called nearly a dozen times and they have still not issued a refund. They are very nice when you call to complain but are completely ineffective at actually solving the problem. I won‚Äôt be using the app any longer and Tim Hortons has lost my daily business.

title: Disappointment
review:
I used this app twice. The first time, I was unable to order because of technical issues, ‚Äúwe apologize for the inconvenience, blah blah blah.‚Äù Fine, it happens. 
Th second time, I ordered 6 assorted donuts to be picked up in the drive thru. My wife was on her way home, so I asked her to pick up and gave her the order number. She came home with an assorted 20 timbits. That‚Äôs what they gave her. Thanks Tims.

title: Service
review:
During the week I have  no issues. On the weekends I have on 4 separate occasions asked for pumpkin spiced lattes (in the fall). When I left it was a regular latte. The 2nd time I asked for a pumpkin spiced latte and when I received it I opened it and it was a regular latte so I  handed it back. 3rd occasion I ordered a hot cappuccino and received a French Vanilla. The 4th time I received a hot cappuccino with flavour. 

Instead of never coming back I went into the store and told the cashier what had happened. Her response was ‚Äúso what do you want me to do about it?‚Äù  I was shocked at her answer and said nothing I would like you to bring it to management to provide training for weekend staff.

 She proceeded to charge me for my order but the lady at the window over heard the conversation and gave me my coffee for free. 
The staff work non stop when I visit and they are always a pleasant.  

I just wanted someone to know that there have been issues. I have had a few one offs during the week.  1/3 espresso 1/3 hot milk 1/3 foam. The new staff tend to top it up with milk to fill the cup and this is incorrect. 
FYI I stopped going to star bucks as your cappuccinos are better than any I‚Äôve had there.

If you put items in your cart from home, then drive to your regular location, park, and try to submit your order, the little timbut runs forever and finally you get an error message. So ok, swipe up the app, reload your items and the little timbit goes running again and another error. So I swipe up again and try a few more times before it FINALLY submits properly. title: Poor app
review:
For such a large company, this app is poor. 

1. It‚Äôs extremely slow on my iPhone XS Max , after taps an option, the app takes for ever to change. 
2. Stores are showing as closed. When I know my local store is open, the app shows it as closed, and I cannot order anything. 
2. Offers are not consistent. I‚Äôm offer of extr 10 points each order is gone. 
4. There is no way to update your email address in the app. So if you have registered with it, your stuck with it. 
5. Staff at Tim‚Äôs don‚Äôt know how to make return onto the app. Sometimes what you order is not available, credits are impossible. 
6. Call support Center is useless. They take your complaint and do nothing about the problem. The people in charge of the app never call back. 
7. Support on telephone is really poor English. 

8. Stores rarely have your order ready when you get to the drive thou window or mixed with another order. 

9. Over all... fail.

title: Lots of potential but...
review: The app is not sturdy enough and needs more work... I was in the drive through line earlier today, and activated an offer with the app. The LTE connection was slow. Then 2 cars away from the cashier, the app decides to update itself w/o warning! Definitely not an acceptable behaviour. It comes back and asks again to authenticate. Of course I punch in my email address in panic and nothing happens. Now in front of the cashier i look like an idiot. I can‚Äôt show my card number (because not logged in), therefore cannot get more points, and lose on the offer I‚Äôd just activated. What a dumb app.!!!

title: Trouble
review:
I use this app every day. It is a buggy mess. My favourite bugs:

The page constantly refreshes for no reason, making me have to restart the app. This happens about 1 in 3 times. 

After reloading the app, the pages won‚Äôt load. Restart the app again. 

I finally make an order which charges my credit card, but doesn‚Äôt go through to the restaurant. Or sometimes, it does go through but the app says it doesn‚Äôt 

If cell phone reception is weak, the app does all of the above behaviours even worse. Or if my wifi is weak, same thing. 

Today I tried reinstalling the app (for the millionth time) and now I can‚Äôt login to my account as the login email never arrives. 

Very very frustrating app

title: Version 6.0.2 isn‚Äôt working for me
review:
I go to McDonald‚Äôs AT LEAST once a day. I know the crew by name and they know me. 

I love the Mcdonalds app.  Ok, loveD until I upgraded to version 6.0.2 and I could no longer pay with my credit card.  Each attempt generated the error ‚ÄúSorry we cannot process your order right now. Your card isn‚Äôt not charged. Please contact crew at the store to proceed. :[40232] [error: 40232]‚Äù

I have logged out, cleared the cache for the McDonald‚Äôs app on my iPhone with iOS 13.3.1 by offloading the app, deleted the app, reinstalled the app and logged back in to add my credit card.  Unfortunately I got the message ‚Äúan error occurred attempting to save your card. Please try again later‚Äù

I spent more than half an hour at a McDonald‚Äôs to see if it would help using their wifi. More than 5 uninstalls, restarts, logging out and in and entering credit card info proved unsuccessful. 

McDonald‚Äôs call centre rep couldn‚Äôt find the error code 40232. He didn‚Äôt want to wait for me to uninstall/reinstall and re enter credit card info but I was quick enough to run through this process that I was able to do it while he talked.  He said he was forwarding to the developers to address.  

Edit 20200209:  created 2 other profiles and tried two other credit cards but still got the error  ‚Äúan error occurred attempting to save your card. Please try again later‚Äù.  Tried on two other iPhones.  Still can not get the app to accept any credit card on the old it either if the two new accounts. 

I hope the McDonald‚Äôs developers can fix this soon.  I am not lovin‚Äô it!

title: Don‚Äôt trust this app.
review: This app made it super easy to order ahead, but unfortunately insecure and should not be allowed on the App Store. The payment system is very sketchy, with no verified ‚Äúinteract‚Äù symbols or anything to validate any sort of secure payment system. Using this app resulted in my McDonald‚Äôs account being compromised. I started getting email receipts of people ordering in another Provence.  It continued happening even after resetting my password to a more secure one. Ultimately I needed to have my card replaced and deal with an investigation to get my money refunded from my bank TD.  McDonald‚Äôs support was not helpful, advised me to just ‚ÄúPay in store‚Äù from now on... why are they advising this and still allowing people into this app?

title: Do NOT link your bank info to this app
developerResponse: {'id': 11644511, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry to hear this. We'd like to discuss this further, please give us a call at 1-888-424-4622 (Monday to Friday 9:00am-7:00pm EST, Saturday 10:00am-6:00pm EST) so we can further investigate.\n", 'modified': '2019-11-04T16:04:22Z'}
review: Back in June I had noticed on my credit card statement that someone had used my McDonald‚Äôs app 3 times on the same day to make $85 worth of purchases in a different province than where I live. My credit card was linked to the app so I could order from my phone and hit the mobile pick up. I called my bank and was refunded and had my card cancelled, but not before contacting McDonald‚Äôs corporate, who confirmed my bank info was not compromised, but rather the fraudsters got a hold of my ‚Äúuser token‚Äù. This tells me the app was not secure, and I never so much as received an apology, explanation or follow up from McDonald‚Äôs. Terrible customer service. I see CBC has already published a story on this problem with other customers. I‚Äôll be contacting the media as well.

title: DO NOT ENTER CREDIT CARD INFO
review: If you live in Canada!! There have been many MANY fraud cases where hackers gain access to your payment method on the app and order hundreds of dollars worth of food for pick-up somewhere in Quebec. I got about 6 email receipts in the span of 10 minutes all from a McDonalds in Quebec. I am in the midst of processing this fraud case with my bank, but I seriously caution you if you use this app! title: When McDonalds make a mistake, you pay.
review:
This App needs lots of work. I was recently charged twice for the same order. Within hours I phoned their ‚Äôhot line‚Äô to request a correction and was assured that one would be forthcoming. Several days later I was advised that there would be no reimbursement but rather complimentary coupons would be issued in the days to come. 
I was a little ticked so decided to cancel my credit card number with them however there is NO mechanism in the app for this to happen. Furthermore, talking to their Guest Relations Specialists is useless. I talked or corresponded with five different Specialists with different stories from each. 
I would NOT RECOMMEND entering your credit card number into the App as you could loose all control of your account. 
P.S: I still like McDonald‚Äôs and will never give them my credit card number again.

title: Massive fail
review: I tried to place my first mobile order today to save time because we were rushing around to get the kids to activities. Ordered and sent my husband the order number. Only to find out AFTER HE GOT THERE that they didn‚Äôt have an order with that number. So I sent the screenshots. Only to find out that unlike Tim Horton‚Äôs and the other mobile food apps I use where I order ahead and it‚Äôs ready when I get there, they don‚Äôt make  make the order until you are at the store. title: Can‚Äôt add credit card

title: App is easily to get hacked!
review:
Warning!! DO NOT USE APP!  I had this app on my phone and unfortunately had my cc linked. Over the course of a 12 hour period my account was compromised by a hacker in Ontario/ Quebec who in turn racked up $600 worth of McD orders. I am in Newfoundland and by the time I seen email receipts it was too late. This individual/ individuals accessed my info and edited personal info..changed name on the account to ...to Abdul Mohamed ....and went on a fast food spree. How a restaurant in Mississauga received 15 online orders simultaneously from the same app with no red flags raised is incomprehensible.  Why a cc is not required to validate orders upon pickup also raises questions. 
My experience with McDonalds corporate was not much better. They assumed zero liability and advised me it was a problem between myself and cc provider!! This despite my cc never being compromised. The security of the Mcd app was and is the issue. Thankfully they did offer me Three extra value meals for my trouble!! What a joke!! I am currently awaiting resolution from my cc company in hopes of recovering the money. McDs has not reached out to me despite emails and phone calls to address the issue. Bottom line the app is not secure. Do not download it and if u do , do not link any payment method!  Multi billion dollar international 
Conglomerate with no conscience!!! Shame on you....

title: Continued Lack of Apple Pay Support is Disappointing
developerResponse: {'id': 12385390, 'body': 'Hi Anthony, thanks for the feedback. We‚Äôll use this info while we continue to evolve and improve the app. Stay tuned for updates!', 'modified': '2019-12-13T18:07:22Z'}
review: Despite being available for some time now, the McDonald‚Äôs Canada app still does not support Apple Pay. The app is well designed and developed, however corporations and developers working with them need to understand that customers do not want to be storing their credit card info in databases with variable levels of security when simpler and more secure options are available. There have been many public stories of McDonald‚Äôs Canada customers having their credentials compromised and multiple orders placed using their credit card as a result. Use of Apple Pay would significantly reduce such incidents by eliminating the need to store card info in your account. McDonald‚Äôs needs to get with the program and support Apple Pay, and stop requiring credit card info to be perpetually stored, especially when it‚Äôs totally unnecessary.

title: Hackable
review: My account was hacked as has been the experience of many others.  Someone unknown by me in another province started to purchase lots of food though my account on my credit card. I will no longer be using this app until two factor authentication is enabled.

title: App is too slow and not user friendly
developerResponse: {'id': 12042857, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for the feedback. We‚Äôll use this info while we continue to evolve and improve the app. Stay tuned for updates!\n\nPlease make sure you've updated to the latest version of the app. We've now added a new 'I'm Already Here' button so you can choose your pick-up method and we'll start preparing your order earlier. ", 'modified': '2019-11-25T16:05:36Z'}
review:
1. Takes one minute to launch the app, another one or two minutes to load the local menu, on my iPhone 6. Compare to TimHortons app, the McD app is 10 times slower. 

2. My credit card expired, the app asks me to remove the card and add a new card with all the information, card number, name, expire date, address, and verification code. Why can‚Äôt I just update the expiration date and code? All other information are same, no need to type in again. 

3. You can order any time, but it only allows you to send your order to the kitchen after you arrived the restaurant. So you still wait in the restaurant for your food to be prepared. Where is the advantage of mobile ordering? Developers, please learn from TimHortons, it detects the distance between my current location and the selected restaurant and calculates the arrival time for staff to prepare my order. When I arrive, the food is right there, I just simply grab and go. No more waiting.

title: Awful - you‚Äôll get hacked too
developerResponse: {'id': 11126575, 'body': "Hi there, we are sorry to hear this. We'd like to discuss this further, please give us a call at 1-888-424-4622 (Monday to Friday 9:00am-7:00pm EST, Saturday 10:00am-6:00pm EST) so we can further investigate.\n", 'modified': '2019-10-08T13:02:51Z'}
review:
Had the app downloaded on my older phone, didn‚Äôt use it for months! All of a sudden, I wake up to a $50 bill on my credit card (thankfully I receive notifications on my phone when a purchase is made using my cc). Didn‚Äôt even have the app on my new phone. Turns out someone hacked my McDonalds account (which had a secured password). 

When I called my cc company, they told me that they hear from people on a daily basis being hacked through the McDonalds app. Not only do I strongly suggest that you avoid McDonalds for health reasons, but now for the sake of your private information and finances as well. Google it, these data breaches are happening all over the world and McDonalds is doing absolutely nothing to mitigate the data breaches and attacks. 

Don‚Äôt believe me? Download the app and watch you get hacked just like the thousands of others who thought the same. Good luck.

title: Ruined by Obvious Data grab
review:

title: Order

title: Unreliable and frustrating with little user control over privacy
review:
Works ok, when it works. Nice that we can effectively collect double rewards on hot drinks, which is the only reason I‚Äôm still using the app at all.

Whenever there‚Äôs an update it requires a new login, which apparently (IME) means your (correct!) password won‚Äôt work and will require a reset. Reset emails don‚Äôt always get sent or arrive quickly - I struggled o get a password reset email for 24h during which time I could not access my account.

There seems to be no way to turn off the ‚Äúhelpful suggestions‚Äù the app tries to push on users while ordering.  Interrupting the ordering process to try to upsell users is obnoxious and spammy.

There is no option to pay at the counter, so you can‚Äôt pre-order without sending your credit/debit card info through the app. App also doesn‚Äôt allow you to order without having location services turned on. Presumably this is all to avoid fraudulent orders, but user be aware.  Perhaps being able to set up an order that could be scanned (QR code) at the restaurant could be offered as an option? There is also no way to permanently set a preferred restaurant; I consistently order from home but at a restaurant  that is halfway along my commute and the menus differ so to order I have to first go to the trouble of setting the restaurant I want manually. I shouldn‚Äôt have to do that every time.

title: This app WILL streal from you!
review:
Special offer of a $3 bigmac ended up with a manager at a store blaming the app for the order not happening, even though i had an order number and had been charged. He went to the back, 3 others were served full meals ahead of me, and i had to go back to work without my solitary bigmac.
Was offered a combo in recompencence, but aftet the initial chat with customer service theres no refund no email no response nothing; just the money taken out of my account.

Do not ise if you cherish your time money and sanity.

title: Ok at best
review: Why does this app not allow the use of gift cards?? Also, It definitely fails when I cannot ask for something on the side such as mayo, salt, or ‚Äúno ice‚Äù in a drink. I prefer doing curb side pickup, so with no options for ‚Äúnotes‚Äù on the order is pretty silly.

review:
Les bons-rabais √©lectroniques devraient pouvoir √™tre utilis√©s dans une commande mobile, c‚Äôest inacceptable que ce ne soit pas possible.

Pas tous les produits sont disponibles 24h. Pour compliquer les choses, cela varie d‚Äôun restaurant √† l‚Äôautre. Le probl√®me est que l‚Äôapplication offre le menu √† l‚Äôheure o√π on fait notre commande. L‚Äôapplication conna√Æt notre position, elle conna√Æt aussi √† quel restaurant nous arr√™terons, elle peut donc √©valuer dans combien de temps nous serons arriv√©s au restaurant pour que notre commande soit trait√©e, l‚Äôapplication devrait donc nous offrir le menu disponible pour ce restaurant √† l‚Äôheure o√π on y arrivera. Un deuxi√®me probl√®me est que certains restaurant n‚Äôoffrent pas de venir porter la commande au stationnement et cela m√™me su des emplacements sont r√©serv√©s √† cette fin. title: Used to work great
review:
The experience has become frustrating because there are great deals - but I can‚Äôt take advantage of them because there is always a disconnect between the app and what‚Äôs available at the restaurant.

For example, I‚Äôll try to order a chicken McNuggets value meal and the app will tell me it‚Äôs not available at the selected restaurant, meanwhile I can go through the drive thru and absolutely order the item. 

I have submitted feedback through the app, and to multiple employees including managers and nothing changes. If anything the problem is expanding to other menu items! 

To make matters worse, some staff know how to apply the mobile app discounts manually when I show them the error while others will tell me they can‚Äôt do it. 

Also, please add Big Mac sauce as one of the customization options, not just ‚Äúmayo style sauce‚Äù because they‚Äôre two different things. 

All in all a frustrating experience.

Received mayo on the size, but also large glops of ketchup and mayo on the burger, twice. Added espresso to coffee, received a standard coffee.

title: Payment stopped working and poor customer service
review:
I was a regular user of McDonald‚Äôs App.  I liked the convenience of ordering and paying on arrival.  Suddenly my payment stopped working.  Oct 14.  Since then, the app will not accept any payment type.

I sent in a help request.  After about 10 days I received an absolutely brutal response.

Gave me several options including uninstall and reinstall.  But if all that did not work, the last recommendation was wait for a new app release whenever.

So from a daily user to a Starbucks user for my breakfast.  Been one month now.

Poor, poor response from such a big company.  Online comments is this is a common problem and they do not seem to eager to fix.

The app does not work unless you put in a payment type and it won‚Äôt accept one.

title: Order ahead of time..... but only on location.
review:
Being that - I would only really need an app to order BEFORE being on location, so that when I arrive I can grab and go - this app needing you to be at the location for them to START making your order, makes the app irrelevant. 

It‚Äôs not like McDonald‚Äôs goes bad quickly.

title: Fail
review:
The purpose of an app is to make things easier and more streamlined. This is NOT easier or more streamlined. This app makes extra unnecessary steps. It is faster to wait in line and order than it takes to order with the app not to mention it doesn‚Äôt allow for mods( other than some very basic). Then your required to have a credit card..... 

Once you get past this you must turn your location over to them which drains the battery as it continues to send feed back hrs after you‚Äôve picked up your order. 1st of all they don‚Äôt need this info at all considering. They don‚Äôt do anything TILL you get there. So I still have to order. I can‚Äôt choose my pick up time it doesn‚Äôt even tell them when I am 5min out to put the food on. 

You order and it does absolutely NOTHING till you arrive so you just wasted all this time fighting with the app and 1/2 the time will not even register that your at McDonalds when you are. So then you have have to order the old fashioned way. Then You might as well just ordered the old fashioned way.  Every so often I give the app a chance and not once has this been fixed

title: Clumsy and confusing
review: Has anyone who developed the app actually tried to use it at a drive through? Some basic real world testing would show you how clumsy and confusing (for the driver and the McDonald‚Äôs employee) the experience it. You have to click to find coupons, then order, then scan for the coffee rewards, then click back and find the coupon screen and scan that - all before the confused employee says you can only scan one thing per transaction. And don‚Äôt even try to accidentally scan a coupon before your coffee rewards. The store employees are often as helpless as the user is. Here‚Äôs an idea - take a look at the Starbucks app and just copy that. Offers are automatically applied to your purchase. Payment is integrate with rewards. Simple and easy to use. McDonald‚Äôs app team on the other hand could serve to leave their computers and go out into the real world where their users are and see what a mess they have left them.

title: McDonalds App Verification Log-In not working

I get the verification email, click the link and when I follow the instructions to log back in, it says my email is already verified. Then when I log in, it says I need to verify my email. It will also only send the email if I uninstall and reinstall the app every time. 

Stuck in a vicious circle for literally over a year now because I can‚Äôt get the app to verify me. But I still get the spam emails offering me deals (that can only be taken advantage of in the app I can‚Äôt use), so at least I get to be frequently reminded that McDonald‚Äôs IT department is incompetent.

title: Still barely works
review:
A year ago I deleted the app because it worked badly. Today I decided to make an order before I drove to McDonalds and downloaded it again in a hope something has changed...

1. Log in. I entered my email and password... oops, it says, it is a new device (device is the same), and I need to confirm it from email. OMG, what a scam can be made on my McDonalds account? A bunch of BigMacs ordered? Okay, I clicked the link in the email, it opened Safari, asked to open the app, I confirmed, but... no more ‚Äúlog in‚Äù option in the app! Only ‚ÄúCreate account‚Äù! At the same time it shows that I am still not logged in. I tapped around randomly, terminated the app... after a minute I was able to get ‚Äúlog in‚Äù option back (don‚Äôt know how), AGAIN entered email and password, and finally it allowed me to proceed.

2. Order. Acceptable experience, but the UI fits badly on the screen of iPhone SE 2016. The orange panel where the app asks to add the item alone or make it a meal goes below the screen edge (only few millimeters visible). I had to guess what is shown there and aim my finger precisely, but was able to proceed. Finally I chose my items and store location, confirmed the payment option, and the app showed me the link to click when I‚Äôm at the store. I put my phone and sat in the car.

3. Pick-up. After a 30-minutes drive, I opened the app again and... it was empty! No active order, no ‚ÄúRecent Order‚Äù, no anything! At least logged in, thanks God. I had to collect order again standing curbside.

How did you test your app? Only the straightforward case? No email confirmation, no old devices? You don‚Äôt save incomplete / not picked-up orders for the case of the app unloading from memory? Stop being lazy please!

title: Used to work great
review: This app used to work very well, but lately has been a major pain! I‚Äôm ordering exactly what the coupon specifies, but keep being told I need to change my order. Very frustrating!!!! This has happened numerous times over the past two months and I hope someone can look into this to figure out where the glitch is.

title: Poor mailer coupons support, mobile order options limited.
review:
The app is decent. Design looks good, but tap the mailer coupons and it brings you to the website from within the app. The website is also very broken, has extremely long loading times and is glitchy. 

This app that seemingly is designed to replace the need to go to the website fails to deliver. Mailer coupons should be updated to work the same as offers do in the app. 

I also tested going to the website instead of using the app to access mailer coupons. It was still glitchy, but somehow loaded more efficiently outside of the app. 

Update 2020 

Mailer coupons work within the app now. Good job! 

Mobile offers are getting worse.They began well, and worked with drive thru orders, now it‚Äôs 90% mobile order offers which isn‚Äôt good. The mobile order options are extreme level limited, can‚Äôt substitute sauces , or add extra patties. Don‚Äôt believe there is an option to use mailer coupons. Offer prices also went up. 

I know you want people to use mobile order, but limiting the offers available through drive thru isn‚Äôt drawing me to do mobile orders, it‚Äôs causing me to go to A&W. They got good offers for both.

I have tried using this app multiple times but every single time I try to use it I log into my account and click on deals, then I have to log in again, and then if I click on order, I have to log in again, if I then Want to check what I ordered last time, you got it I have to log in again. 
It‚Äôs easier to order pick up through Skip the Dishes and do without the so called deals. My time and sanity are worth the price difference. 
Plus the fact the restaurant doesn‚Äôt start making the food until you get there so you may as well just use the drive thru because you certainly aren‚Äôt saving any time using the app.

title: Have to be at the restaurant?

The whole point of using the app is to order it ahead of time and for it to be READY when you get there! Not to have to arrive and then STILL have to wait! Poor design! Also the coupons almost never work.

Cette fois-ci c‚Äô√©tait un rabais pour commande de plus de 20$ en ligne (bref, bonne chance pour r√©ussir √† avoir une commande entre 20$ et 25$)!

title: Lots of problems
review:
I downloaded the app to speed up ordering and payment, as well as having the latest deals available when I placed my order. 

Several times when I go to pick up my order, they require payment, even though it is billed through the app. 

The only way to prevent a long delay at the drive thru is to either pay - again, or leave. 

As soon as I leave I receive an email with a receipt showing where I am billed through the app.

 I can then turn around and wait inside in line and wait for the manager to figure it out and refund. 

Most often, time is more important than dealing with it, but today I am done with the app. 

I will have to see if another ‚Äúfast‚Äù food has it figured out.

title: Possibly the worst app in the App Store
review: You would figure that McDonald‚Äôs would want to make it easy for us to give them money... they made it impossible to even create an account on their app. I have tried to delete the app and reinstall, reboot my phone, even store it in a Big Mac box over night. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre sorry, looks like you already have an account...‚Äù followed by, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre sorry, we have no record of that account...‚Äù when I try password recovery. This happens even after I make a brand new email account that you could not possibly have a record on.

title: Note To The Starbucks Powers-That-Be
review:
I know this is unusual, but I wish to 'review' YOU, the Starbucks powers-that-be.
Why?
Because you listened to me.

I lobbied you to make it easier for me, the customer, to leave a tip whenever I use your app to make a purchase.
For awhile, I had to access my transaction history in order to edit my purchase.
Not anymore.
You've created a "leave a tip" feature that drops down from the top of my phone screen, once my bar code has been scanned and my purchase has been completed.
All I have to do is tap on the banner, and instantly I'm taken to the "edit purchase" screen, where I can add a tip to the purchase price.
As you know, your valiant baristas work hard and deserve the tips that I leave them.
Their expertise and personableness are much appreciated, always.
And now YOU have made it easier for me to express that appreciation.
So it's really true:  you DO listen to your customers.
Keep this up, and you're gonna give the food & beverage industry a good name.
Yours truly,
PhiL  >^‚Ä¢_‚Ä¢^<

title: This app has been a life saver but can be frustrating!

On that note, there are minor improvements I think would make the app better! Like, when adjusting pumps of syrup, I wish it would add or subtract in 1/2 pumps! Or allow me to add certain ingredients to a drink that don‚Äôt appear as an option (like if I want to add a scoop of matcha powder to my vanilla bean frapp). I think more open, accessible options might improve the app experience!

title: Starbucks challenges/stars etc
review:
Hi,
The app works great, some of the stores choose not to recognize the scan part of the app, (eg St Albert Trail store downtown), and when I raised the concern of them not wanting to scan the app on my phone, I never received a reply from Starbucks Customer Service. I am very disappointed with the lack of response from Starbucks and the inconsistencies between stores. Is it a training issue or just a complacency issue? How will I be compensated for the miss on both the store and Customer Service?
PS: Anytime I have had even a very minor issue with Tim Hortons, a reply with some form of compensation comes through in 24 hrs)
Thanks,
Mark

title: Th√© Staff
review:
The staff are run off their feet. It is a very busy place and yet they all have a smile on their face and go out of their way to please each and every customer all the time..... incredible service!!
And I should note that the manager knew we have a friend who turned 95 a few weeks ago and this 95 year old lady used to drive herself to Starbucks in a regular basis to grab a coffee until she had a mishap at home and broke her hip one night .  Now she is recovering from surgery at home and we had a drive by birthday for her and Starbucks on University Avenue provided her and her three children their coffee.   The young staff also picked up a get Well card several weeks earlier and all signed it And sent it to the hospital.  Well done starbucks employees!!!!

title: Good, but...
review:
I like the app. Use it all the time... too much probably.  The local Baristas are starting to no my name.  I love that when I redeem stars that it goes to the most expensive drink. Thank you. That is greatly appreciated; many businesses do the opposite.  I do have a couple of ... umm ... Issues? Requests? Both?  

The issue I have that bothers me the most is finding a drink I love, but finding out it was considered ‚Äúseasonal‚Äù.  As winter faded into spring, my new ‚Äúgo to favourite‚Äù for both myself and my granddaughter, went from an already pricey drink at about $5 per, can now be modified from something similar, but is an expensive treat at over $7 a drink.  That‚Äôs a lot for a nice coffee. I am going to have to cut back a lot on coffee treats.  Once it‚Äôs on the menu, can‚Äôt you leave it on the menu even if you are not promoting it, especially if the ingredients are part of the stores‚Äô year round inventory?

One other request for the app specifically is a spot to modify instructions. For example, when I order in advance (which I do about 98% of the time), I cannot request a caramel wall for my younger grandchild. So, she either doesn‚Äôt get the drink the way she wants or I have to order at the store when the rest of my order is already complete. Defeats the purpose of the mobile order.

The app has been adding drinks to my order. Apparently they are featured drinks, but if you don‚Äôt notice it‚Äôs on there, you pay for it. Not cool. Plus, when it adds drinks, it will do it when I reload my card. Instead of placing the order like it use to, it shows me I have more drinks. The first time it happened, I inadvertently loaded my card 3 times because it didn‚Äôt take me to the place where it says my order was sent, but back to the review that lists my drinks with one , sometimes two, additional items.  Not cool.

Anyway, if you could fix those hiccups and add the one modification, then the app could be a 5!

title: An App Designed Around Convenience
review: The Starbucks app is truly designed around making the customer experience more convenient, and that, invariably, translates into increased sales for Starbucks. The app makes it easy to transfer the balances of Starbucks cards to the app itself, while also maintaining a balance on a primary card. This allows you to redeem your points from both the app and your primary card. You can also order items from the app, add very specific instructions, save your items, and the re-order from your list of saved items in the future. The app has worked flawlessly for me, and I‚Äôve been using it for a few years now. Well done, Starbucks.

title: Honestly Cheaper To Just Go In
review:
This app has a nice layout, lots of information and it is easy to find what you are looking for. It is intuitive and has many helpful features. HOWEVER the only payment option through the app is Starbucks gift card loaded onto the app. If you have a gift card that is great unless the balance on the card is less than your order cost. While the app does let you reload the card, the minimum re-load amount is $10 and you cannot combine multiple gift cards to fulfil an order. 

So here‚Äôs my story: my order is $10.28, I had a gift card loaded that the app said had $7 left on it, and I had to reload an extra (minimum) $10 to cover the $0.28 of my order. THEN the gift card, instead of now having $17 just had $10 on it. I don‚Äôt know what happened, if the card actually had no money on it anymore and the app told me wrong or if my reload replaced the money on the card. Either way. now I STILL don‚Äôt have the $0.28 I need so I have to reload ANOTHER minimum $10. I was scared to have it replaced again so I reloaded $15 to a card that had a $0 balance. Just to do the math for you, I have now spent $25 on an order of $10.28 so that Starbucks can entire I spend all that money in their stores. Such a scam and a total money grab. I feel like I got tricked into spending more than I wanted to at Starbucks. The kicker is I probably would have ended up spending that much at Starbucks eventually anyways but now that I HAVE to I don‚Äôt wanna. 

TLDR: had to pay more than twice for my order because of crappy payment system in the app

title: Love the app... but needs some fine tuning...
review:
So for the entire holiday season the app wouldn‚Äôt let me select egg nog in any drink. Even after verifying the store indeed did have it.  I called Starbucks twice and they were very nice but in the end nothing was fixed. The issue I have now is the app lets you select how many pumps of syrups or sauces you want. But when your order prints at the store it does not show the numbered amount of each selection. So your not getting what you ordered. I also have an issue when I order an iced caramel macchiato. I add caramel syrup to my drink and when I go to pick it up they omit the vanilla syrup stating they didn‚Äôt know if I wanted both. Yes I want both that‚Äôs why I ordered it. That‚Äôs what the recipe calls for. I also wish there was an option to add a smaller amount of money to the app. Like $5 or even $2 instead of $10. Sometimes I‚Äôm only a few bucks short and it sucks to have to pay another $10. 

Other than the problems above I love the app! It‚Äôs so much easier when I‚Äôm racing to work or the bus just to be able to run in and grab my drink and run back out. Especially if I haven‚Äôt eaten breakfast and my shift starts in 5 minutes. I‚Äôve more than once pounded back a slice of banana bread on the run. It‚Äôs also great for those of us that have social anxiety and hate having to go up to the till and order. I almost always use mobile order.

Now I have to call these dimwits and get them to do it over the phone.  I haven‚Äôt even gone back to Starbucks because I‚Äôm so frustrated with all of this.  Also, the app can be glitchy at times, to the point of crashing, but otherwise it‚Äôs pretty nifty. If they could fix these issues, I would gladly change rating to a 5 star.

title: A grand app!
review: The Starbucks app is grand, eh? I use it daily. It knows what I like, which is more than I can say for other apps I‚Äôve had relationships with. It‚Äôs also very encouraging, too. It reminds me to make friends (or keep the ones I have) on their buy-one-get-one-free happy hours. But really, every hour spent at Starbucks is a ‚Äúhappy hour‚Äù, is it not? Oh, and it helps me save money by offering star rewards challenges that are geared mostly towards the items I prefer. Truth be told, I love their bacon Gouda breakfast sandwich & I‚Äôll take on any star challenge that includes this breakfast sandwich. It‚Äôs so Gouda, I eat it for lunch and dinner. It‚Äôs a breakfast sandwich, sure, but my mouth doesn‚Äôt know what time it is, nor does it care. All it cares about is that salty, crunchy cheesy yumminess. So, I‚Äôll say it one more time, the Starbucks app is grand!

title: Unusable for me
review:
I used to use this app frequently to pre-order for pickup until about a few weeks ago when the app was updated. I used to order as guest and checkout using apple pay, but can no longer do so. The app lets me in as guest but as soon as I try to pick a sub and add it to cart it prompts me to login or signup for rewards, no way of getting around it. To make matters worse when I try to create an account I‚Äôm given an error.

So I can‚Äôt buy as guest, I can't login because I don‚Äôt have an account, and I can‚Äôt create an account because it‚Äôs giving me an error.

On the plus side I‚Äôm not spending money at Subway anymore lol

title: Missing some options!
review:
I got this when I was trapped in the hospital with an amputated foot, I was sorely missing being able to PICK my food, so I wanted to appease myself with some "window shopping" in this app. Only to discover I could never place an order with it! That was when I first wrote this review, June/July 2020.

About 8 months later, just got a forced update, NONE of these following issues have been addressed!

Firstly I ALWAYS order two cheeses, Swiss and the white cheddar. It'll only let me pick one! No matter what sub I construct! I can double the cheese, but only the SAME cheese!

Secondly, I always have my subs microwaved, there‚Äôs only grilled or panini press! I don't get to have a hot sub then? Excuse me, but this silly "grilled" thing is a comparatively new idea, for most of the time I've been going to Subway, the only way to have a hot sub was the microwave. I don't like the crispy HARD bread the other two options provide, I love the softness of the microwave. Where‚Äôs my microwave option?

Thirdly, one of my favourite subs is the Pizza Sub. Where is it? One of Subway's original, classic subs, no sub shop can exist without a Pizza or Pepperoni sub. It's the most basic sub recipe. Do I really have to take the Italian one and modify the hell out of it? (At least that includes the salami I like to add). All I see is a Pizza Melt, with nearly no ingredients and that "Melt" concerns me.

Fourth, since I can't place an order right now, it seems the least I can do is construct my favourite orders the way I like them and save that so I can order them quick once I can place orders again. But there's no "Save", anywhere! Obviously I want Favourites, but if I tap that I'm told I have none - obviously, as I'm new - but there's no Add Favourite button, just Start An Order. Okay? So, I start. I pick my sub, Customize it how I want and... nothing. No option to Add As Favourite. All I can do is add it to my order, no other buttons. On my order "bill" I look around, nothing. No Add As Favourite. I Google how to add Favourites, I discover a Reddit thread in the Subway Subreddit where someone asked this, his answer was that you had to PLACE the order (and pay for it), then the Heart icon appeared on your order. Really? ONE screen where we can add Favourites, and only after we actually order it? I TRIED maybe proceeding with the order, then Cancelling out of the Confirmation screen, but the Place Order button was disabled (I thought maybe because I needed to add a Payment Method or Delivery Address to my account, but exiting the order I added PayPal but logging in only brought me to my PayPal profile, and there's no option to enter my address). I'm blocked from the one thing I should be able to do!

Finally, this is only an iPhone app? No love for us iPad users with a larger screen and more powerful device? It‚Äôs ridiculous to see a Profile-orientation-only app which can't use the full screen and is formatted only for a more rectangular phone screen. Excuse me if I want to use my better device for this.

New additions: Firstly, I note that last time I missed mentioning, there's no notes on subs! Subway's gimmick is to customize your order according to you, no note to add customizations not covered? Say, for example, all of the above? There's a note for the whole order, but that wouldn't do the job well if there's multiple subs.

Secondly, since it seems NO Subway offers its own delivery, such the delivery doesn't seem supported in this app, I use SkipTheDishes - which unfortunately can't work with this app, since this DOES offer better options (like the full range of subs). I note that the drink selection is pathetic compared to when I visit, so I call Subway to address this and all of the above.

I was told these are the bottled drinks, it's the Fountain drinks which are interesting and they can't do what LITERALLY EVERYONE ELSE DOES and include Fountain drinks in a drink holder. Okay. So I came to this app to "dry run" a pickup order, the Fountain drink selection is just as pathetic! Worse! How unimpressive is it to offer the usual suspects and nothing more? And not even the whole set. Pepsi Real Sugar (is that just Pepsi?), Brisk Iced Tea, Brisk Lemonade, 7Up. That's it. Screw diabetics and dieters, no Diet Pepsi, no Diet 7Up. And Subway was the first place I've seen with the advanced soda fountains, tons of sodas with optional flavours like cherry or strawberry. EVERY Subway I've been to in the last decade has them. Where are THOSE options? (Pretty sure the reason is that they're too lazy to keep a list of what each location offers so they only list what ALL offer).

title: Holy.
review: This app is absolutely atrocious now. Now you can‚Äôt order regular wraps anymore? My goodness.
