title: Useable, but frustrating
review:
This app is useable but has so many annoying little glitches that I find myself frustrated every time I have to place an order. 

One, when they advertise the curb side pickup, you click it and it goes on to order. I go all the way through my order and ..... it‚Äôs not curb side. It says I have to run in and get it. Realize the second time around that I have to click this small button at the top of my order after it‚Äôs done to choose the curb side option. This should be a DEFAULT when rerouted from the curb side advertisement on the front page. 

The customization is a problem. Sometimes the sliders don‚Äôt appear and I can‚Äôt choose ‚Äúextra‚Äù or ‚Äúless‚Äù on certain toppings. Want extra cheese? Too bad! You can manually write it under ‚Äúother instructions‚Äù but unlikely they‚Äôll see it and since you weren‚Äôt charged the petty 50cents extra they probably won‚Äôt give it to you anyway. 

Reorder function is broken. I have to manually put in and customize my sub EVERY time. Reorder option leads to a never ending loading screen or just doesn‚Äôt respond altogether.

Favorites function is broken ‚Äúwant to favorite this order for next time? Click the heart!‚Äù But the heart is unresponsive and the order will not save. 

The app has potential and I‚Äôd rather order online than walk in during the pandemic but this app needs a LOT of work to be on par with other fast food services. It gets a two star because I can use it, but not without it taking me 10 minutes to navigate and deal with all the app‚Äôs problems.

title: This app used to work

Today I am forced to update, resets all my preferences, forces me to login again.  I finally place the order, I try to add my subs, it says no cheddar, I modify the 3 subs to add mozzarella, add 3 cookies, all the options are missing so I need to leave oatmeal in the comments. 

Pick up the subs, all of them have no cheese, I go back and ask the store to correct it but they refused.  I check the order on the app and the cheese has been removed. 

If I make the error and you do not want to correct it that‚Äôs fine, when you make the error it is up to you to correct it.  Was a regular customer.

Also, in the latest update they seemed to have broken a couple of things:

‚Ä¢ It appears you can no longer order extra cheese; and
‚Ä¢ The BMT (one of their best-selling sandwiches) is no longer available in the app at any store that I tried. That can‚Äôt be right. Must be a bug.

So basically the app is currently unusable for our family, because our order always includes a BMT and extra cheese. ‚òπÔ∏è

title: Borders on fraud
review:
I ordered for pickup on the app, which processed my order, charged my credit card, and said my order would be ready at my chosen location at 3 pm that day. I get there and the store is closed. The ‚ÄúGot questions?‚Äù link on the order page gave me the a phone number for the location that went to a voicemail that hasn‚Äôt been set up yet, and there is no customer service number for Subway in Canada.

I reported the transaction to my credit card company, which refunded me immediately because I could not contact the merchant.

Charging me for a purchase from a location that is closed and providing no way to call the company to request refund borders on fraud, and I am considering a complaint to the Consumer Protection Office.

title: Ok when it works, but room for improvement.
review:
Nice app but I‚Äôd like to see the following improvements:
1. CLEAR steps on how to reactivate a frozen rewards account, not just a useless contact support link or sign out option.  subways ‚Äúnew digital experience‚Äù isn‚Äôt all its cracked up to be and good luck talking to a person.  trying to unlock a frozen rewards account isn‚Äôt accurate on the how we can help support page.  the frozen rewards link in faq points to a phone number and the phone number options 1 and 3 points to the how we can help support page.

2. Where are the breakfast sandwiches in the app menu?  All I see are English muffin choices.  Checked under all sandwiches too.

3. Would be nice to have an option to pay with gift card and credit to use up that last balance, but I suppose you can just add more funds, but after the issues trying to unlock a frozen rewards account I‚Äôm reluctant to load any funds because the gift card gets frozen too!

4. I‚Äôve also been having trouble lately redeeming rewards online and instore lately which I‚Äôm sure is what led to my account being frozen.

5. Finally I had to figure out in my own that a frozen rewards account can be unlocked by submitting a gift card inquiry and waiting.  Despite my asking them to let me know why it was frozen and what else I can do the account was simply unlocked and I was never contacted to let me know it was reactivate or why it was deactivated.  A little follow up would nice and isn‚Äôt unreasonable IMHO.

Good luck hope this gets addressed soon.

title: US offers appearing instead of Canadian offers
review:
I ordered through the app and the app was advertising a ‚Äúbuy 2, get 1 free‚Äù offer. I noticed I had no discount in my cart, so when I went to pick up my subs, I inquired regarding this offer. And after speaking with the supervisor she was told over the phone it was an offer in the US. 

Turns out, you YOURSELF have to go into Account Info settings and go to My Way Rewards and change the country yourself. This should be chosen when you first create an account OR the first time you launch the app. This is unacceptable. 

I managed to get in touch with my local franchisee who explained the problem and told me how to fix the problem (as I stated the solution above). It‚Äôs not his fault, but this is a serious flaw in the app that the developers need to fix pronto before more and more people have this issue.

It doesn't matter if I'm in store or ordering online, I'm still giving Subway my money. If I could give this 0 stars I would, the app punishes you for using it.

They'd rather you stand in line like a caveman and waste 5-10 minutes.

title: No gluten free options

So I guess I‚Äôm resigned to going in now and waiting to place my order which is something I wanted to avoid with the app. Also reading the reviews a lot of people have problems with ordering and payment with the only response being a non-answer answer and directing people to call or email them. title: Finally an acceptable app....
developerResponse: {'id': 5477624, 'body': 'Hi there- we are here to help! Please contact our support team at (833)-778-2929, or by email at appfeedback@subway.com. Have your app version, device type, and the steps to reproduce any errors ready- so we can investigate and address these concerns for you. Thank You!', 'modified': '2018-10-12T14:57:56Z'}
review:
Here‚Äôs my reviews over the past 2 years...

2018 - Causes more frustration than anything else.    Rewards scan unreliable.  Not sure if this is due to poor scanning hardware or poor staff training or both.  Paying with app is also unreliable.

September 2018 update...still doesn‚Äôt work.  I feel sorry for staff as the app must be as frustrating for them as it is for us customers.  I thought I could avoid the app by just using a physical rewards card but still need to use the app to redeem rewards.  The app failed two times in a row.  App shows a lack of real world testing before deployment.

February 2019 update...tried 2 days in a row.  Amazed after all this time the bugs in the app are still not worked out.  Still need to use physical reward cards to pay. App is useless for payments.  Kind of scared to use credit card with a company so technically incompetent.

February 2020...finally works...üôÇ

title: Apple Wallet Support
developerResponse: {'id': 10976550, 'body': "Your feedback is really important to us and we're always looking for ways to improve your experience! We currently do not support Apple Wallet. We are working with Apple to resolve this discrepancy, and we‚Äôre also working to improve our guest experience in this area.\r\n", 'modified': '2019-09-30T13:20:21Z'}
review:
There is no reason this app should not support Apple Wallet. The US version has since launch years ago.

Edit: Responding to developers response. 

‚ÄúWe are working with Apple to resolve this discrepancy.‚Äù This is an uninformed answer. If you referring to your app being listed as having Apple Wallet support and therefor you have submitted a ticket to have it removed, that would be the only condition in which your statement would hold true. 

Instead, it is a matter of taking the feedback you have received multiple times, and implementing the feature request. There is no discrepancy for you to work with Apple on. Your app does not have a feature ‚Äì lots of people have asked for a feature‚Ä¶ therefor you should seriously consider adding this feature. 

I‚Äôm sure someone on your marketing team said it‚Äôs a bad idea as we decrease our likelihood of displaying promotions to customers, or it decreases the chance that someone will place an order through the app ‚Äì but when you are not interested in using those features when trying to check-out at one of your restaurants and the application has inadvertently logged you out, so you quickly log in and then go to the page with the QR code‚Ä¶ only to be faced with a loading screen while it tries with all its might to display your QR code. 

The benefit of having Apple Wallet support is it is not tucked away behind a potential login error, and is saved locally to the device. Additionally for those paying with ApplePay, it‚Äôs in the same app as the customers method of payment. 

I am adjusting my app rating from 2 stars, to 1 stars as it appears you were unable to understand the feedback given. The rating will again be modified at which time the app is updated to support this feature request.

title: Update Canadian app gift card debacle
developerResponse: {'id': 9749982, 'body': 'Hey there. We are here at (833)-778-2929, Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM-8:00 PM EST and Saturday and Sunday, 8:30 AM-5:00 PM EST. review: I am very please to update that my issue was resolved after nearly three months. I topped up funds on my digital gift card via the Subway app. Funds were topped up successfully however they were US$ not CAD$. After many emails with what felt like no luck. I checked my app one day and noticed the funds were now converted in CAD funds. Very thankful for that to be fixed. I never did have any luck with the variety of phone numbers for customer service. I don‚Äôt know if it was the emails or posting reviews but my problem eventually got fixed. Learning curve...I will buy a gift card from the store now instead of using app. Otherwise, app is very convenient to use.

title: Poor store coordination
developerResponse: {'id': 7915586, 'body': 'We apologize for any inconvenience these scenarios caused. Please contact us by tapping "Contact Us" in the menu of the app, at (833)-778-2929 or by email at appfeedback@subway.com- so that we can make this right! Please mention your concerns, the restaurant location, and your user name while contacting us. We look forward to hearing from you.', 'modified': '2019-03-26T13:53:29Z'}
review:
The app works fine but integration with the actual stores is severely lacking.  

Store hours are not consistently coordinated with the app allowing you to place orders with stores that are closed.  Automated replies confirming not only the order being accepted and ready for pickup, at a store that is closed leads you to believe you can pickup your order only to find the store closed upon arrival with no staff to assist.  

Also, no way to cancel or amend the order after you hit send. If you have a change or the store is closed then you must go through a whole bunch of bother to get a refund, if they will even give you one.  No huge deal on a single item but it‚Äôs a problem on a large order. 

Lastly, the whole menu is available to order from on the app in spite of many locations not carrying all items.   However, the system will accept and process payment for items that are unavailable meaning that the items you order have to be manually changed over the phone or on pickup.  This is an inconvenience and also creates an awkward pricing disparity between what you paid and the actual amount that should be due on you order.  The app works, but the system fails.  

In short, just ho stand in line if you must have a subway sub.

title: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll start preparing your order when you‚Äôre 5 minutes away!‚Äù
review:
That has never happened for me.  I have been stopping at a 24 hour location (drivethru) on my way home from work very late at night, and not once has my order been ready for me.  In fact, more than a couple times I‚Äôve pulled up to the drive thru and said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to pick up my mobile order‚Äù, just to be told ‚Äúoh... we don‚Äôt have that‚Äù, and then 10 seconds later, ‚Äúoh it just popped up‚Äù.  

In the app it tells you you‚Äôre XX minutes away from the location, and it‚Äôs never accurate.  I‚Äôve watched for when it says ‚Äúwe‚Äôll start preparing your order‚Äù, and I‚Äôve literally been pulling up to the store.  You need to fix that... what‚Äôs the point of ordering ahead of time, if they don‚Äôt start making it until you arrive?

title: Soggy like the fries
review:
This is one of the worst apps I‚Äôve ever used. Ordering from A&W is frustrating at the best of times, but this app somehow makes the experience worse. 

The user interface is a confusing mess. When you submit an order, a countdown timer starts immediately, forcing you to race from wherever you are to the restaurant. 

You can only pay with credit card, so sorry to everyone trying to get out of dept. 

The wording is also super confusing. It shouldn't require a PhD in astrophysics just to customize a meal. 

The most frustrating part though is that unlike the McDonalds app which gives you multiple pickup options, this app requires you to go in to the restaurant, or curb side pickup. If you go through the drive through, the brains of the employees will implode as they have no way to confirm you are you. ‚ÄúAre you Steve?‚Äù Geez!

A&W did what they do. Took what should be an easy process and made it bloated and complicated. With the McDonalds app, I can sit at home and easily create a meal, pay and when I get close to to the store, I can easily pick up my meal in the drive-thru with a code. 

With this app, I am so frustrated by the time I pick up my food, I resent the small personal loan I had to take to afford the cost of tier meals.

title: good coffee but
review:
I tried to order my free coffee online as well as a teen burger which one I wanted to be bun less  with the lettuce wrap.

For whatever reason I wasn‚Äôt able to do this online as it said system error so I went through the drive-through.

The gentleman at Appleby line at approximately 10:55 AM on Monday, January 18 said he had to charge me $1.99 for the free coffee as the drive up promotion had expired. I informed the staff member on the speaker when I was ordering the food and he said there was nothing he could do I then went to the window paid for the burger at which point in time he was arguing with me saying that the promotion was over and there‚Äôs nothing he could do. i said so I‚Äôm gonna go over to the parking lot there and order of coffee for free versus himjust handing me one.

He said that is correct so I pulled into the spot and waited for them to waste the time of another staff member to come out to hand me my free coffee.

Fast food has now become medium food at ANW I guess. I‚Äôm not sure who the marketing manager was to allow something to be free online but not at the drive-through.

Perhaps they were giving way too many coffees or they wanted more people to download the app. 

Either way this became quite Time consuming and not worth the discount for a free cup of coffee

title: Transfer wrong payment
review:
2021-01-11  12:22:36
My name is Terry Wong
I live in Stoufville Ontario Canada.
Currently my A&W App is showing a Beyond Meat Burger special at $3.99 each so
I made an APP order using my A&W mobile App for a Beyond Meat  Burger adding Cheese on the above date/time and I was charged a total price of $5.52 with tax.  It was charged to my credit card linked to the A&W APP and my digital receipt shows the above charge with authoriztion number.
The order number as shown on the receipt of my A&W app order is 45183-489-210111-1077498 and the restaurant name/ID is Stouffville.  When I arrived to pick up my order around 15 minutes later, I was told by the restaurant their information on the screen was that I only ordered a Cheddar cheese and the total they are showing on their screen is only $0.95.  As a result they cannot give me a Beyond Meat burger even I showed them my digital APP receipt on cell phone which clearly shows that I purchased a Beyond Meat Burger with Cheese and I was charged a total amount of $5.52 instead of only 95 cents.  I am not sure what happened why a mistake like this can happened.   I spent quite a bit of time in ordering and driving to pick up my food and have to spent quite a bit of time to talk to the store manager but eventually he said he could not help me because his screen is showing something quite different.  In order not to delay the other drive thru customers behind me, I have to reorder my Beyond Meat Burger with Cheese again at full price.  Meanwhile, I believe A&W have charged me $5.52 which I did not get anything so I am requesting this amount to be refund to my credit card.
I can send you copies of my digital receipt of $5.52 and the A&W Stouffville #4396 Receipt which the manage said he got only a Cheddar Cheese order from me but with no Beyond Meat burger.  Hope I can hear from you guys soon.
Regards 
Terry Wong

review: I‚Äôd like to eat from A&W almost every week. If I reorder a previous meal the app crashes. You have to order everything manually each time. This app is costing A&W sales revenue.

title: Great except...
review:
The app usually works really well and the food is always either just ready or about to be ready when I arrive.
It‚Äôs a bit of a pain though when someone else orders but I go to pick it up, since it tracks the person who did the ordering. 
My only other real complaint is when I choose the East York Town Centre location in Toronto, and order the cod burger, there is no option to ‚Äúmake it a combo‚Äù. Instead, I have to add the fries and drink separately which costs more. The option is there for other burgers, just not the cod burger. I‚Äôve mentioned it twice at that location but it is still a problem. Other locations seem to have that option.

title: Apple Pay broken, UI horribly outdated
review:
I was outside an A&W, chose my food, and when I went to pay with Apple Pay, it kept asking me to add cards to Apple Pay despite the fact that I have several cards in Apple Pay that work just fine outside the app. After several attempts, I wasn‚Äôt able to place my order. A&W lost my money and lost my trust and admiration for the brand. 

Also notable that the app looks like it was designed in iOS 3 and A&W never bothered to update it in 10 years. This gives off the vibe of a small and/or incompetent company, not an international food chain. 

Fix ApplePay integration and please get a competent app developer to design a modern app that better represents your brand.

review: The app works great for mobile ordering but I can‚Äôt use coupons in it. Therefore must forgo mobile ordering in order to save $$. If coupons were offered in the app that would be the best case scenario, no need for mailer coupons, customers save money and there‚Äôs less paper waste.

title: No delivery option
review:
Literally went through the ENTIRE sign-up process (incl. creating a new email address at my domain host), only to discover that the link to get the app., directly under the image that reads ‚Äúdrive-thru, pick-up, and DELIVERY‚Äù, is actually only for standard drive-thru and pick-up ordering.  No delivery option with the app., itself.  (You need to use a different service provider, thus no need for this app. at all, if you‚Äôre interested in delivery.)

I wish I had the last 20 minutes of my life back. :(  

Just...don‚Äôt try to trick customers into thinking they can get delivery directly from A&W.  They MUST use a third-party food delivery service, which they probably already have signed-up for or, in my case, wish to avoid using.

title: Amazing quality but needs to compete
review:
A&W team, the revitalization of your company over the past few years has been amazing.  I love the updated branding which correlated into the quality of the food.  They taste like real burgers I would make at home.  I like the switch to biodegradable straws.  I like how many locations are now 24 hours.  I would choose you over the competition but give me incentive through your app like McDonald‚Äôs.  Give me offers through the app that I can apply to my order.  I think this will result in a lot more traction in the use of your app and consumers switching to you. 
As I‚Äôm rating the app I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd use it as there is little incentive other than the time saving of waiting in line in the store and placing my order. However if offers were given through the app it would be the only way I order with your company. It completely changed how I ordered at McDonald‚Äôs and is the only way I do now, please follow suit! The layout and store locator are good and you can order and customize easily.  3/5

review:
The promo code field comes before the credit card field. So you have to enter the promo code twice, OR go to the bottom of the page to enter your credit card, and then go higher to fill out the promo code...

I brought this to the attention of A&W and they didn‚Äôt give a rip. And they indicated you are suppose to fill out the form by going to the bottom of the form, and then go back higher up...

Also I was standing right outside of an A&W and the top choice for a location was one farther away...

Then it sent a survey which I filled out but the app had an error and it failed to send.

Three failures in one use. Haven‚Äôt seen an app this bad in a LONG time.

They also don‚Äôt have a confirmation page after you place your order. Considering people are walking and using their phones they could make mistakes on their order. So there is no way of making sure it‚Äôs what you wanted.

review:
I work the night shift and when I leave work sometimes I want a burger. Good thing is A&W is on my way home. 

I put an order in through the app and expect the burger to be ready when I show up to the store. 

But that is not the case. Today I showed up to pick up my burger at 6:57am but I was told the meat is still cooking. My order wasn‚Äôt ready till 7:07am.

If the timing issue was fix then this would be a great app. This app does save me time since I don‚Äôt have to tell my order to the staff but it would be nice to have my order ready or very close to ready when I show up. 

This has happened many times that my order is not ready when I show up.

I downloaded this hoping to order breakfast and pick it up in my office. First I found out that the username/password for the coupon site don‚Äôt transfer over.

Then the registration failed 3 times.

I got into the app to see it doesn‚Äôt support coupons either?! Finally determined to get my breakfast I select my food items, see the totals and I have to enter my payment details. And it fails. Over and over again. Thinking it‚Äôs because I‚Äôm copying and pasting from my password manager I enter it manually. Nope. Then I try variations of my postal code. Nope. My name? Nope. Nothing works and then it tells you in a tiny alert to email an address and you can‚Äôt even copy it. It looks like they‚Äôre having serious instability in their backend handling. Come on A&W!

What a waste of time.

title: Scam
review:
I downloaded the app to make it convenient for my family by ordering ahead and then going to pick up the mobile order. About 10 minutes after submitting the order I arrive at the location and the staff confirm that they did not receive a mobile order. 

I ended having to order AGAIN and pay for it AGAIN. 

I checked my banking as it was pending and assumed it wouldn‚Äôt go through yet I still got charged for the mobile order I never received. 

I also e-mailed the listed e-mail and received no reply about my concern. 

This app shouldn‚Äôt be available if it can‚Äôt perform its purpose.

title: Help with the App
review:
Hi there,
I work for A&W and I love the idea of having an App for Mobile Orders.
However, I did notice that we are behind in terms of Design and Development of this App.

I am a Designer and I would love to know if you guys a hiring people to improve this App.
I already work for the company in another department. I would love to join the team to make this App the best of all.

title: Really rough early version
review:
Higher user on-boarding overhead than similar apps. No EMV Pay (aka Apple Pay.) Raw markup showing as plain text during acceptance of terms and when displaying the FAQ. Poor order flow (if I tap into an item, don‚Äôt start with a zero quantity that I then have to increment before trying to move further into the flow. Start at quantity 1.) Rough modal dialog text. Infinite spinner upon attempting to save credit card details (that wouldn‚Äôt even be necessary if Apple Pay were supported.) And so on.

I‚Äôll try it at least once to complete an order but so far it would be safest for the vast majority of users to wait for a more complete app.

title: Racist or stupid pick up policy
review: Back in October 2019 I was very pregnant (9 months along), I ordered pizza and had my boyfriend whom I live with pick up the order. Upon pick up they gave him the hardest time either maybe because he didn‚Äôt look like a white girl named Stephanie? They asked for his license plate number and drivers licence. We don‚Äôt understand why as they never even wrote it down? They almost refused to give him our pizza. He asked to speak to the supervisor and they refused to do so. He eventually showed him ID ... for a pizza with the correct pick up name. I was extremely upset over the issue and phoned the location to speak with the supervisor and asked who I was speaking to. The girl on the phone said her name was ‚ÄúTaco‚Äù and started laughing as she knew I must be phoning to complain. The customer service was terrible I reached all the way to the manager (his personal phone) who wasn‚Äôt there and also asked for the franchise owners information. We phoned another location to confirm if this is the policy and if they ask for customers licence plate and drivers info all the time. Supposedly it is stated somewhere in their policy but the customer is not aware of this policy. I highly recommend that if the option is pick up that they notify the customer after the order that they check ID upon pick up if you are not the initial customer that placed the order. I have never had this issue picking up my friends orders prior to this. Due to this issue I have stopped having Dominos pizza probably due to the fact their app doesn‚Äôt explain the pick up policy to customers. Seems very judgemental and unnecessary to demand such information just to pick up a pizza. Robbing another customers pizza sounds like it must be a serious crime.

title: Coupon $ not being subtracted üò°
review:
I have been a regular user of this app, and only recently discovered that the coupon discounts are not actually being applied to my orders!  I have no idea how long this has been happening.  The app says the coupon has been applied, which would change the price of a large deluxe pizza from $19.99 to $17.99.  To my surprise, I looked at the the subtotal before tax and saw that the price was $19.99.  I tried some other coupons to see if it was only the the large pizza coupon, but it was all of the coupons.

It is misleading to indicate that the coupon as been applied, when it has not.  I am no longer using this app!

review: I love this app. It reminds me of my drunk nights in uni! The user interface is easy and not too gimmicky. It‚Äôs a true testament to the app that you can be inebriated and operate the app flawlessly. However, I‚Äôm an adult now (allegedly) and I want to order off the website like a big girl. Except the website is not fully functioning. The pages are pretty but the pop up boxes seem to shut the whole thing down. So now I have to sadly relive the joys of my youth by ordering off the app. Now I‚Äôm seeing that the app is not as aesthetically pleasing as the website. Make the app a little prettier and you‚Äôve got a gold mine, or, please fix the website.

title: Garbage app, didn‚Äôt end up ordering
review:
Hey Domino‚Äôs, you lost a sale due to how crappy this app is. After selecting my local restaurant and trying to start a carry out order for later in the day, I was told that future ordering wasn‚Äôt possible at this time. Don‚Äôt know why, since the place was already open and I would‚Äôve been setting a time well within their hours of operation. Okay, well, let‚Äôs try it anyway. The $7.99 medium pizza coupon is worded in a very confusing way, but I entered all the details for two pizzas, and they came up way more expensive than they were supposed to be. No price breakdown in the cart available. Even the Contact Us section is unusable, since it requires all kinds of information as if I‚Äôve already put in an order for delivery, which I had not. So I gave up and you missed out on a sale.
ps, I like to be able to keep my iPad in portrait mode. Why does this app only work in landscape? We‚Äôre ordering food, not watching a widescreen movie.

title: WORST PIZZA EXPERIENCE EVER
review:
I have ordered from Dominos many times, and today was no different.. I ordered 3 thin crust pizzas and an order of the hot chicken chunks . I always ask for extra sauce for the thin crust pizzas so I get more flavour and less dough .. 
unfortunately what I received was nothing to share write home about .. 
the pizza was so over cooked and dry and literally zero sauce .. I felt like I was taking a bit of burnt construction paper;(  
So I called the store (saint Hubert in Montreal ) and the guy answered, I kindly explained the situation and was hoping we could rectify the situation and get a new or fresh order , but to my dismay and shock .. the man told me that he made the pizza himself and that he would not help me and that there ¬¥wasn‚Äôt anything he could do ¬¥ ! 
I was shocked and really disappointed as I have been a loyal customer for years and this really disrespectful and zero care for my food quality .. 
unfortunately I will NEVER order from them again and I will be canceling my dominos app..

title: Hands down THE BEST pizza!
review:
I am a HUGE fan of Donino‚Äôs pizza. Not only are they hot and quick and fresh every single time I get my pizza, they are extremely friendly to talk to. Each time I pass my local Comox, BC Dominos, I always go in and tell them how much I love and enjoy their pizzas. I know this review sounds over the top, but they truly have something special and I won‚Äôt get a pizza anywhere else! 
Natasha Davis, Comox BC

title: Great for Ordering. Bad for Paying.
review:
Most strait-forward app for placing an order.

Choices for paying are not clear. Cash is "available," but you have to read the small text to see if the local store is accepting cash (it wasn't). Cash is the default button, always lit up even if unavailable.

I have a debit card, but I have to select Credit/Gift Card to use it. The debit-at-the-door option is greyed out as unavailable. The local store accepts debit cards at the door.

After taking the time to make an order on the app, I still had to phone to find out if and how I could pay them for it. It could have been just a phone order, no app needed. Or I could have walked away, thinking that I didn't have any acceptable means of payment that another place would accept (and who would have had my business).

Because you haven‚Äôt set up your app to use Apple Pay, you enabled a criminal to steal from me. It is very simple: there are bad people in the world. Ignorance is no excuse, and yours is a willful one, which only makes this worse. 

The one thing I regularly purchase without Apple Pay, either through an in app purchase or physical transaction, is pizza from one of your stores. I‚Äôll be calling my bank and then your main number in the morning.

title: Payments buggy at times
review:
Used it a few times just fine, but one time it didn‚Äôt work properly and it turned into a mess. Customer service response was far from ideal. Ordered through the app, entered card information and tried to load funds into the app. $10 two times. Both times was given an error after entering the security code on the back of the card saying the transaction failed and to please contact your bank. Didn‚Äôt think anything of it at the time and instead tried to pay for the meal alone rather than loading funds into the app. It processed the payment just fine that way. However, when I went and checked my bank statement it showed the two $10 charges were both taken out. Contacted bank and they said funds were gone to contact Wendy‚Äôs. I figured it might just be a pending charge and it would show back up after midnight or something. Contacted Wendy‚Äôs customer service and they said they saw the two charges showing as pending on their end and said it would likely show back up on the card after midnight as well like I thought. The next day came and I got 1 of the $10 charges back and not the other. Contacted Wendy‚Äôs again and was asked to send a screenshot showing the charge that was not returned back. Sent it with the case number in the subject line as they requested and never got any reply to that email. Contacted them again after a few days and then got into a huge scuffle with customer service again. Still missing 1 of the $10 and it‚Äôs been 8 days since the charge. It‚Äôs fine when it works but be warned of when it fails, you‚Äôll have an impossible time trying to get the missing money back.

Edit: The missing $10 never showed back up in bank account like the first charge did but eventually got a gift card for the missing $10 from Wendy‚Äôs. The only issue I have now with the app is the inability to pay part of an order with the gift card and the remainder with a credit card. From what I can tell it requires you to redeem and load the gift card into the app and then you can add more to the digital balance with a credit card, but you can‚Äôt just add the exact amount remaining for the order, it needs to be one of their given options. It would be a lot easier if you could pay with more than one payment option per order. So the pay once with CC after applying whatever digital balance you have in the app to the order. After the first mess trying to load funds into the app I‚Äôm definitely not willing to try loading funds into it with a credit card again.

July 2019 update:

Still useless. End of story. 
‚Äî‚Äî-

Offers and coupons - nothing. Ever. Zip. 

Customize your menu items - sounds good until...

Mobile ordering - nope. The only real reason to have an app like this. 

Payment - instead of tapping your card at the restaurant you could complicate things by trying to add funds here and use the clunky process (for an order you can‚Äôt make in the app anyway).

Ok, but it can find the closest Wendy‚Äôs?  Sometimes. But so can every mobile map app and internet search engine without another waste of space app. 

Whoever thought this was a good idea to release, and then let sit useless for years, should be fired. It‚Äôll just frustrate your customers and show them you don‚Äôt really value them or their time.

title: Wendy's: Modern Slavery and Fatism
review:
From Some of Us: "For the last 20 years, there‚Äôs been a quiet revolution in the tomato fields of Florida. A group of immigrant farmworkers called the Coalition of Immokalee Workers (or CIW) has been organizing to eradicate human rights abuses, like wage theft, sexual assault and in extreme cases, modern slavery which once ran rampant in the tomato industry, and improve working conditions and wages for people who pick the tomatoes we eat. They‚Äôve made incredible progress, but now Wendy‚Äôs is standing in their way."

Most of the largest fast food chains, including McDonald‚Äôs, Subway, Burger King, and Taco Bell have all signed on to the CIW‚Äôs Fair Food Program. They have agreed to pay an extra penny per pound of tomatoes to raise wages and only buy from fields where workers‚Äô rights are respected. Wendy‚Äôs is lagging behind the rest of the industry and is refusing to sign the agreement, despite being asked five times since 2007."

Farm workers and their allies are planning to march in the lead up to Wendy‚Äôs shareholder‚Äôs meeting in New York on May 18, and we want to make sure they can bring along a huge petition to show than consumers are behind them. Last year, the SumOfUs.org community helped push Trader Joe‚Äôs and Chipotle to join the Fair Food Program, so we know that big corporations listen when farmworkers and consumers stand together."

Wendy's Canada refuses to use the real Wendy as a spokesperson because of her weight, hence, the thin "Wendy" in our commercials. Just say NO to Wendy's!

title: Location services required?
review:
So, I was given a bunch of offers, but wasn‚Äôt able to actually USE them unless I turned on location services. Meaning, they already knew which offers they were going to give me (as they didn‚Äôt change when I turned on my location), but demanded I give my gps in order to use it. Clearly the gps wasn‚Äôt required for the offers, otherwise I wouldn‚Äôt have gotten those offers to begin with. So why do you guys even need my gps location?

I know, I‚Äôm not meaning to sound paranoid or anything. But I just don‚Äôt see why my GPS **needs** to be on for this app to function if the offers are given without the gps.

Maybe have the profile make you select a postal code, then only be able to use the offers in that geographical area (or however far the offers range to). Or, even use the credit card‚Äôs address to select offers?

Don‚Äôt go giving people offers and then saying ‚Äúfork over your gps information in order to use these offers‚Äù. Either offer them either way, or disable the offers altogether unless location services are turned on (don‚Äôt show the offers before asking for our location info).

It is a real Royal Treat when you go expecting to get a parfait for $.99 when you paid full price for the first one and end up spending $6 instead of .99. Bring back coupons that I can print and then there is no surprise when you get to the window to pick up your stuff.

title: Bad App and Not Great Customer Service
review:
So, I ordered a small order using the app, and placed the order.

Then, I wait the 40 mins it tells me to wait, but after the 40 mins I get a bit suspicious, but still wait, thinking that sometimes that it takes longer. After a while, I call the place asking what is taking them so long. The person I‚Äôm on the phone with says that there is no order on the system and says there is noting she can do. I tell her it shows up on my app but she says it‚Äôs not in her system and there is nothing she can do. Okay, fair enough. 

She then directs me to some other help line, and when I call them, they take my phone number and direct me back to the store. The same person answers and offers to direct me back to the line I just called. This musical chairs keeps going and I just hang up. 

When I call the helpline on the app, they just take my order and say they‚Äôll ‚Äúlook into it‚Äù and can‚Äôt put my order or issue a refund. 

Just use Uber Eats, better service and same food.

title: App is gimmick - doesn‚Äôt work, don‚Äôt waste time
review:
This app has two distinct sections for deals: the colonel clubs deals and then a general deals section. The colonel clubs deals don‚Äôt work even at restaurants who have colonel club (as indicated on the KFC website). If you ask for the manager they might help you, but most regular cashiers have no idea what colonel club is and can‚Äôt help you. As for normal deals, the information on the app as to which restaurant has which deals is either outdated or simply wrong, so the only way to tell if they have a deal you want is to phone the specific restaurant. Finally, you need a postal code of a nearby residence to even access specific restaurants - there‚Äôs no other way to manually choose a restaurant. The postal codes for the restaurants themselves don‚Äôt work, and you‚Äôll get an error message. So you actually have to live near a specific restaurant to actually access its deals or order online function in the first place. 

The app is a complete disaster, and things will pop up and disappear, and you‚Äôll often get rerouted back to the horrible insert postal code screen. 

And they don‚Äôt even have prices beside the items on the menu! It‚Äôs fast food! We go to you for cheap prices! Show us the prices. 

This app can‚Äôt be serious; it‚Äôs a gimmick without functionality and will just frustrate you.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time!

title: The most difficult app I have ever used
review:
There are a lot of problems with this app,
1. The size of the text obscures field for entering information, choosing the order location, entering payment and selecting item for your order, 
2. It does not clearly show the entire delivery address. You can‚Äôt easily confirm if the address is correct or if the suite number is correct,
3. When try to set your location for pickup and delivery it is easy to change your location on the map. But it is hard to enter your location in the address box provided,
4. Selecting items for your order is awful, it is not clear if you have added an item to your order as you have to repeatedly tap the confirm but and then the add to order button.
5. If you create a KFC account the location, or  delivery information is actually saved between orders. I have to re-enter all the information each time I order.
6. Payment, if you are paying by credit card fields are hidden for entering the credit card information, it is not clear what field you are entering. The billing address is hard to enter within the credit card payment page. 

I am not impressed with ordering using the app. It is probably easier to order by phone.

title: This app is an embarrassment.
review:
There are so many areas that SHOULD be improved that make ordering using the app extremely frustrating.
For starters, the fact that there is no order tracker. After an order is made, a notice on the screen says approximately how long it will take for the order to be delivered. When I refresh the screen, that information is no longer available and there‚Äôs no way of knowing how far along your order is. It doesn‚Äôt have to be intricate GPS tracking, even a simple one like Dominos offers would be great.
The deals are also very confusing. I have signed up for the VIP Colonel‚Äôs club and have never received coupon codes . So, every time I miss out on a deal because I need a coupon is frustrating.

I also think there should be a separate section for Colonel‚Äôs Club deals so that everything is in one place.

The look of the app could do with some updating too.

title: Brand Suicide - this app IS USELESS!!!
review: I don‚Äôt understand why a company like KFC would EMBARRASS themselves releasing an app that doesn‚Äôt work, and then they keep it up here OVER A YEAR LATER!!! Are you trying to suicide your brand? Maybe the people in charge over at ‚ÄúYum‚Äù brands, haven‚Äôt heard that it‚Äôs 2019‚ÅâÔ∏è This app would have been understandable in 1995 when the Internet was infant - today??  Not a chance; you guys just looks like fools who have allowed 8 year old children to write this app. No response to anyone for over a year? No updates to correct problems that render your app to a useless state? This isn‚Äôt just the ‚Äúodd crash‚Äù happening in an otherwise working app. This is absolutely a NON-WORKING app that you leave up and purposely WASTE peoples time! That‚Äôs not only unprofessional, it‚Äôs IGNORANT of your company! My time is valuable; and if you don‚Äôt respect your customers time....well, that makes you an horrible company to deal with. So the answer....me, and most likely every single person who has attempted this ridiculous app, we DON‚ÄôT deal with you, ever! Goodbye to customers. Like I said in the title, BRAND SUICIDE!! Pathetic.

title: Just use a regular web browser
review:
There's a reason the app hasn't been updated for over a year.

Like a previous review said, the Colonel's Club section of the app is basically useless as pretty much nobody who actually works at KFC knows what it is. The other part of the app is just a wrapper for the website, and even that, the app can't do well. The app uses old assets, and therefore everything appears huge. That in itself wouldn't be a problem, but the design elements actually prevents you from being able to do a lot of things, like inputting a promo code in a pop-up dialog box. Doing all this on an iPhone 8, by the way. I ended up just going to KFC.ca in Google Chrome. Worked much better.

Save yourself time and space on your phone.

title: Needs a lot of work.
review: The app itself seems to be fine, but it requires a lot of work to be fully functional. For one, the Colonel‚Äôs Club requires a new card when switching phones, when it should be integrated into the KFC account and therefore only requires a simple sign in. The card itself also cannot be added to the Wallet since it keeps saying the servers cannot be reached. Same goes for the Colonel‚Äôs Club deal cards. The app is also not optimized for wider aspect iPhones (it‚Äôs designed for 16:9 so bars appear on the top and bottom of the screen). This app could be a whole lot better, but sadly the devs do not care nor listen.

title: What a piece of garbage!
review: When you have almost 150 reviews in the App Store and you are ranging around one star, you need to go back to your marketing and IT people and tell them to get their act together. Why are you even leave this garbage app on the App Store is beyond me. You ask for all kinds of personal information to use the app, with absolutely no privacy statement upfront that the user can agree to, and if you are willing to take a chance and give KFC all of your personal information, it won‚Äôt work anyway because the app can‚Äôt reach the server! Seriously folks! You should really consider hiring people who are beyond the primary school to write your app. Whoever put this piece of nonsense on the App Store should be fired. When you attempt to modernize and put an app on the app Store ends up making your company look like a bunch of amateur jokers, you need to go back to your board members and tell them that you‚Äôre incapable of running the company. Seriously have never been so disappointed in an app before, and I‚Äôve never seen an app with almost 150 ratings score around one star in total. At what point will you guys wake up and take this nonsense off the App Store, your complete clowns.

title: One of the most neglected restaurant apps ever
review:
Note:  they've just updated the app, and there is no visible differences, and the months-old bugs that everyone is complaining about are still there. 

Besides the fact that a lot of restaurants don't even accept this app, or know about it, it's just amazing to me it is on version 6 of the app with not a single revision to actually address its obvious bugs. 

The company doesn't even bother to read the terrible reviews pointing out the bugs - otherwise they'd fire whoever made this app and get it fixed.

title: Lacking, slow, or unusable. Pick from THAT combo.
review:
I'm in north east BC have the Club Card so I figured I would use this instead of showing the emails to the cashiers (who don't even know about the Colonel Club most visits).
It did not have an option if you were already a member, just an option to sign up.
On very fast wifi and on 3G it kept timing out with "Uploading Data" or "Downloading Data".  It also just wanted to use my iPhone Passbook, which it never could finish setting up. If this just popped up with the weekly deals I would be happy but it is WAY to slow and does apparently nothing.
